Gracias a la producción de leche que obtiene, puede elaborar queso en cantidad, por lo que comenzó a dedicarse a la venta de queso y carne a una ciudad cercana, pues tiene muchos clientes y la demanda se incrementa constantemente. “Me va muy bien en mi trabajo, pues existen días en las que no me abastezco con mi propia producción y tengo que comprar a otros ganaderos”, afirma. Este es su segundo crédito con KIVA y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Dominga, invertirá los S/.300 soles en la compra de queso y carne por cantidad; para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en: Dominga, 59, is a joyful woman. She lives with her husband, Felipe, with whom she has five children. However, she only lives with two of them in a house that they have rented for two years. Dominga works raising cattle. She has 15 total, in addition to good-quality sheep. Thanks to the milk that she gets, she can make cheese in bulk, which is why she started working selling cheese and meat in a nearby city. She has many customers and demand is growing constantly. "Things are going well for me in my work; there are days where my own production is not enough and I have to buy from other ranchers," she says. She is on her second loan with Kiva and she feels grateful for the financial support that she receives to move forward. She promises to make her payments on time. Dominga will invest her S/. 300 soles in the purchase of cheese and meat in bulk to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy cheese and meat.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald is a rice grower. He has a 1.5 hectare rice field and he has been cultivating his land for two years. Aside from farming, he is also engaged in a hog-raising business where he raises 20 piglets. Gerald is married and his wife owns and manages a vending business selling variety of agricultural supplies. 

The couple works hard to support the education of their two children and to save for their family's future. Gerald would like to improve his rice field by proper application of farm supplies to his rice crop. For him to achieve his goals, he is now requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 which will be used to buy fertilizers and insecticides and pay laborers who help him during the planting period.  

Gerald hopes and prays that his requested loan will be granted so he can further secure his family future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide and pay laborers.

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa, from Pandahan, SND, Lanao del Norte, is 45 years old, married, and has three children. To make a living, Nimfa has been running a general store selling a variety of food and home-use products in the local community for years now, earning 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Nimfa joined GDMPC and is now requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional goods to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell.

loans.name: Vald´z Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Vald´z está conformado por tres integrantes que son familiares y viven en la misma comunidad. La fiesta más grande de dicha comunidad es cuando celebran al señor San Antonio el día 13 de Junio. Don Apolonio tiene 45 años de edad está casado desde hace tiempo con la señora Francisca juntos formaron una familia con seis hijos de los cuales dos aún dependen de dicha pareja y se encuentran estudiando su educación primaria. 

Don Apolonio se dedica a la venta de fantasía y mercería desde hace 20 años platica como inicio su actividad “Yo trabajaba como empleado en un negocio grande me gusto mucho la venta de estos artículos y fue como inicie la venta”. Esta vez está solicitando el crédito para comprar más artículos de mercería, fantasía y materia prima para la elaboración de los accesorios que él crea: moños muy llamativos y bonitos para adornar el cabello de las niñas y jovencitas. Comenta que nunca asistió a un curso para aprender a elaborar los moños aprendió practicando todos los días, su trabajo es muy bueno se esmera mucho para que los moños de las niñas duren mucho tiempo. Don Apolonio vende sus artículos en los tianguis recorre todos los rincones para así obtener un poquito más de ganancias. Le gusta mucho tener trato con las personas por eso se esfuerza para dar un muy buen servicio. La única dificultad es cuando las autoridades no lo dejan vender en los tianguis; en la mayoría de los lugares en los que vende les exigen una cuota para poder trabajar. A pesar de esto, a Don Apolonio le gustaría llegar a fabricar sus artículos de fantasía y tener las herramientas necesarias pero también es necesario tomar algunos cursos para aprender a crear otros accesorios. El grupo está muy agradecido con VisionFund y Kiva por la oportunidad de recibir un crédito ya que los tres podrán seguir invirtiendo en sus actividades económicas como Eliud invertirá en su taller mecánico y Doña María invertirá  en la compra de maíz para la venta de sus tortillas.
texts.en:
The Vald'z Group is made up of three members who are related and live in the same community. This community's largest festival is when they celebrate Saint Anthony on June 13. Apolonio is 45 years old. He has been married for some time to Francisca. Together they started a family with six children, of which two are still dependent on the couple and are primary school students.

Apolonio has sold notions and sewing items for 20 years. He says of the beginning of his work: "I worked as an employee in a large business. I liked selling these items very much, and that was how I started the shop." This time he is asking for the loan to buy more sewing items, notions, and raw material for the production of the accessories he makes: very striking and pretty ribbons to adorn young girls' hair. He says that he never took a course to learn how to make the ribbons. He learned by practicing every day. His work is very good, and he takes great pains to ensure the girls' ribbons last a long time. Apolonio sells his items in the street markets and goes around to each corner in order to earn a little bit more. He likes dealing with people very much, so he makes an effort to provide very good service. The only difficulty is when the authorities don't let him sell at the street markets; in the majority of the places where he sells, they demand a fee in order to be able to work. Despite this, Apolonio likes to make his notions and to have the necessary tools, but it is also necessary to take some courses to learn to make other accessories. The group is very grateful to VisionFund and Kiva for the opportunity to receive a loan since the three of them can continue investing in their economic activities. Eliud will invest in his mechanic shop and María will buy corn for selling tortillas.

loans.use: to buy sewing items and raw material to make his ribbons

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a hardworking entrepreneur who has business buying and selling frozen products in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to buy additional frozen products like chicken, tapa, corned beef, etc to sell in her frozen products business.

Jennifer has been in this business for five years. Jennifer earns additional income from motorcycle transport.

Jennifer has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional frozen products like chicken, tapa and corned beef to sell.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce has operated a kiosk business from home for the past six years, selling to passersby and neighbours. She cited seasonality and theft as her challenges.

With the KES 25,000 she wants to purchase iron sheets to construct her house. Her dream is to see her children get better education and become important people in the society.

loans.use: to purchase iron sheets to construct her house.

loans.name: Khourp's Group

texts.en:
A successful mother of six children residing in Battambang province, Khourp is an industrious farmer who does rice cropping on two hectares. The current business brings her about 38,300 KHR per day. 

Khourp has been with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, for five cycles and she has successfully paid them all back. The past loan has improved her family’s living conditions and made them better, so she feels confident to take a new loan with VisionFund. 

Now she and her one group member are seeking a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer, insecticide and pay plowing fees. She hopes that she can increase income from her current business and build a new house.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide and pay plowing fees.

loans.name: Gloria Jamileth

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 31 años de edad es madres de 2 hijos los cuales son menores de edad y en compañía de su compañero de hogar se dedican a la agricultura especialmente a lo que es la siembra y cultivo de café. Fueron sus padres quienes le enseñaron desde muy pequeña esta actividad ya que en su familia es su único medio de ingreso económico para cubrir las diferentes necesidades como ser: vestimenta, alimentación, medicinas con muchas restricciones, entre otros. El terreno que ella en compañía de su pareja cultiva es propio ya que sus padres le heredaron un pedazo de tierra para que ella pudiese trabajar y pudiese tener un ingreso. Ella en la actualidad quiere proteger y dar mantenimiento a sus cultivos para evitar que sean infectados por la roya o por la broca que es un bicho dañino y destructor.

Gloria ha solicitado aun financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para comprar insumos como: urea, abono, herbicidas, fertilizantes entre otros para proteger su cosecha de café.

Sus planes para el futuro es poder expandir sus cultivos por medio de la compra de tierra para poder cultivar más café y generar más ingresos para su familia y para su hogar. Ella también sueña con darle a sus hijos la mejor educación, verlos crecer y graduados universitaria mente.
texts.en:
Gloria is 31 years old and the mother of two young children. She and her partner plant and raise coffee.  Gloria's parents taught her about cultivating coffee from a very young age, since it was her family's only source of income and the only way to cover necessary expenses such as clothing, food, hard-to-obtain medicines, and others.  

The land that she and her partner grow on is their own, as her parents gave them a piece of ground that she could work and earn income from. Currently she wishes to protect and preserve her crops, making sure that they don't become blighted or infected by the borer, a damaging, destructive insect.

Gloria has requested financing through the COMIXMUL cooperative to purchase supplies such as urea, manure, herbicides, and fertilizers among other things to protect her coffee harvest.

Her plans for the future include expanding her planting through the purchase of additional land. More land will mean more coffee and greater income for her family and her home. She dreams of giving her children a better education, seeing them grow and graduate from college.

loans.use: purchase supplies to help her grow coffee.

loans.name: Sisi Kwa Sisi Group

texts.en:
Regina, who is in her mid 30s, is married with one child who goes to school. She runs a grocery business and also has a small shop. She has been in the grocery business for two years now and has opened her small shop just recently. She works fro 8.00 am to 9.30 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Regina's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to open a small shop with things like bar soap, powdered soap, cooking oil, blue band, candles, macron, salt and sweets. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to contribute to buying food.  She will use this loan to increase the inventory of her grocery by buying more beers, juice and spirits to meet the customers' demands. She dreams of renovating the business premises. 

Regina will share this loan with her loan group "Sisi kwa Sisi" with nine members. The member of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase the inventory of the grocery by buying more beers, juice and spirits to meet the customers' demands.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva, de 37 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su esposo Magno, con quien tuvo 3 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con uno de ellos en su casa propia. Eva se dedica a la ganaderia pero tambien vende productos comestibles en un pequeño puesto que acondicionó al frente de su hogar. Le va muy bien en su negocio pues también aprovecha vender el queso que elabora gracias a la leche que producen sus vacas. Pues la principal actividad económica de Eva, es la crianza de vacas y ovejas en cantidad, esto lo desarrolla gracias a la ayuda de su esposo, quien los alimenta y cuida en las alturas, donde se instalan chozas provisionales muy acogedoras por varias semanas. Ahora desea seguir con el mejoramiento de sus animales, para obtener buenos resultados. Confiesa que su secreto es alimentarlos con pastos naturales. Este es su cuarto crédito con KIVA y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero qye recibe para seguir adelante.
Eva, invertirá los S/. 300 soles en la compra de comida balanceada para sus animales
texts.en:
Eva, 37 years old, is a simple woman. She and her husband Magno have three children, only one of whom still lives at home with them.  Eva works in cattle ranching, and she also sells consumable goods in a small stand that she built in front of her home. Her business is going very well, and thanks to the milk she gets from her cows, she is also able to sell cheese.  Her main economic activity is the care of a number of cows and sheep. She is able to do this thanks to the support of her husband, who feeds and cares for them in the high pastures, where they have built some temporary, but cozy, huts that are in use for several weeks. 

She now wishes to improve her animals to get even better results. She admits that her secret is to feed them only natural grasses. This is her fourth credit with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support that helps keep her moving forward.

Eva will invest S/.300 soles in the purchase of nutritious foods for her animals.

loans.use: purchase a balanced diet for her animals.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
Jessica, de 26 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos con quienes vive en la casa de sus padres. Jessica se dedica a la agricultura, tiene 2 hectáreas de terreno agrícola, donde comenzó a sembrar productos regionales. Lo que más le gusta a Jessica, es dedicar la mayor parte del día a sus sembríos de café y plátanos. Ya tienen 2 años dedicándose a ello. Y se siente feliz y realizada, ya que es su propio negocio, por eso desea sembrar en mayores cantidades. Lo que le molesta a ella es la lejanía de su terreno agrícola, donde tiene que caminar muchas horas para poder llegar, pero tambien es consciente de su buenos ingresos por eso ella está ahorrando para comprar su casa propia. Este es su cuarto crédito con KIVA, donde agradece el apoyo financiero que le brindan. Por otro lado se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Jessica,invertirá los S/. 2000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus plantas de café.
texts.en:
Jessica, age 26, is married and has two children with whom she lives in her parents’ house.  Jessica is a farmer.  She has two hectares of farmland where she started to grow regional products.

What Jessica likes the most is devoting the greatest part of the day to her coffee and banana crops.  She has been doing this for two years.  She is happy and fulfilled because it is her own business.  Therefore, she wishes to plant in greater quantities.  What bothers her is how far away her farmland is.  She has to walk a lot of hours in order to be able to get there.  However, she is aware of the good income.  That is why she is saving to buy her own house.

This is her fourth loan with Kiva.  She is grateful for the financial support that has been given to her.  She pledges to make her payments punctually.

Jessica will use the requested 2,000 soles to buy organic fertilizer to nourish her coffee plants.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es:
Amelia, de 24 años, está casasa con Gedor y tiene un hijo pequeño con quien vive en su casa propia. Desde hace 2 años emprendió la difícil tarea de la agricultura. “Desde niña aprendí todo lo necesario para cuidar de los granos de café pero no me dedicaba en comercializarlo ni afrontaba las posibles dificultades. Ahora que conformé mi familia las cosas son distintas”, comenta. Es por esa razón que ahora tiene mucho más cuidado y se siente segura pues recibe el apoyo de su esposo. En esta temporada de café no le fue tan mal a pesar de la plaga que atacó a varios cultivos, pues ella siempre procuró mantener sus sembríos mejorados, además de poseer una variedad de café que no fue atacada por la plaga, es por eso que espera tener buenos ingresos en esta oportunidad. Este es su segundo crédito con KIVA, donde agradece el apoyo financiero que le brindan, por otro lado se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Amelia, invertirá los S/.500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus plantaciones de café.
texts.en:
Amelia, 24, is married to Gedor, and has a small son who she lives with in her own house.  She started the difficult work of farming 2 years ago.  "Ever since I was a child I learned everything I needed to know about caring for coffee crops, but I never sold them or had to deal with any of the difficulties that arise.  Now that I have my own family, things are different," she says.  This is why she now takes much more care, and she feels secure because she has the support of her husband.  

In this coffee season it didn't go too badly, in spite of the fact that there was an outbreak of pests.  Amelia always sought to keep improving her crops, and also, she had a variety of coffee that was not affected by the pests.  This is why she hopes to have good earnings at this time.  This is her second loan with Kiva, and she is grateful for the financial support that they provide.  Also, she promises to make her payments on time.

Amelia will invest the sum of 500 Peruvian soles in the purchase of organic fertilizer to nourish her coffee plants.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.en: Edilberto runs and operates a food store or eatery chain in his place in Trinidad, Bohol. He has been in the business for more than a year now. This is the source of his income. Edilberto is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients for food vending like vegetables, meat, seasonings and others. With this, he will be able to improve his business and augment his income.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for food vending like vegetables, meat, seasonings and others

loans.name: Teu's Group

texts.en:
Teu, 44, is a single man and he lives in Battambang province. To overcome the financial burden, he does rice cropping as the main source of income for his family. He supplements the income by selling various kinds of fruit. He has been run this business for 24 years and can earn about 52,100 KHR per day and manage to save 5,900 KHR each day after his daily costs. 

Teu has been with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, for two cycles and he has completely paid back the past loans. Now he is leading his group of three members to apply for a new loan. As the leader, he will spend his loan portion to buy fertilizers for his farmland and use a portion of it to spend on buying fruits to resell. He hopes to extend his farmland so as to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his farmland.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is 48 years old, married and supports a family of three children. She runs a hardware business in Kericho town, this has been her income-generating business for the last twenty-eight years, and she gets an average monthly income of KES 80,000. 

She has borrowed KES 30,000 and with this loan she intends to purchase more stock for sale including spades, boxes, and watering cans among others. She anticipates getting profits which she will use to expand her business, repay the loan and save.

Miriam dreams and hopes to see her business expand, have a brighter future and better living standards and be financially stable; she also hopes to save money to enable her to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase hardware.

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is a resident of Masyoro in Sheema district. She is 40 years old. She grew up with support from the well-wishers who gave her accommodation, school fees and food in exchange for  work on their farms. She dropped out of school after primary seven and joined a local building group where she was trained in brick-making. She later got married and they started to work together for survival. 

Together with her husband, they got a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from Ugafode micro finance which they used to expand their brick-making project. Unfortunately, her husband died, leaving her with four children. 

She is now requesting a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to increase the working capital in her business. In the photograph is the loan officer and the client.

loans.use: to hire labourers to help with the brick-making.

loans.name: Nelson Gilberto

texts.es:
Nelson Gilberto es originario del municipio de El Sauce, es un joven de 24 años que desde muy pequeño a la edad de 15 años empezó a trabajar para ayudar con los gastos del hogar a su mamá, ya que no contaban con la ayuda de su padre.
Actualmente labora como operario de limpieza donde desde las cuatro de la mañana se levanta para iniciar a las cinco de la mañana barriendo las diferentes calles del municipio.
En este momento tiene la necesidad de adquirir un préstamo para comprar una bicicleta que le sirva como medio de transporte para trasladarse a su centro de trabajo, ya que tiene que estar muy puntual y le queda bastante alejado de su casa.
Confía y pide a los inversionistas de kiva que a través de Ceprodel le apoyen con su solicitud para poder cumplir su objetivo de comprar su medio de transporte.
texts.en:
Nelson Gilberto is a native of the municipality of El Sauce.  He is a 24 year-old youth who has worked ever since he was only 15 years old, helping with the household expenses in his mother's house, because they were not able to rely on the help of his father.

He now works as a cleaning employee; at 4 in the morning he gets up to start working at 5am, sweeping the various streets of the city.  

At this time, he needs a loan to buy a bicycle.  This will serve as a means of transportation to get to his work center, because he has to be very punctual, and it's quite a distance from his house.

He trusts and requests the Kiva lenders and Ceprodel to support him with his request, so that he can accomplish his goal of buying a means of transportation.

loans.use: to buy a bicycle

loans.name: Crispin

texts.es: Crispin de 55 años está casado con Julia y tiene 7 hijos pero actualmente vive solo con su esposa en su casa propia. Crispin se dedica a la agricultura; sus 30 años de experiencia en los cultivos de palta, plátanos y cítricos le ayudaron a adquirir todo lo que hoy tiene. De esa manera ha podido instalar locales comerciales en la ciudad de Lima, donde esta una de sus hijas y es ahí donde envía su producción de paltas y plátanos, exactamente en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad capital. Sus 3 hectáreas de terrenos de cultivos le dan la seguridad de que puede seguir creciendo siempre y cuando cuide y cultive bien sus plantas. La siembra de café es muy rentable y es uno de los productos bandera de su localidad, por eso casi todos los pobladores se dedican a estos cultivos. Julia vio en esto una oportunidad de negocio, es por ello que también se dedica a la elaboración de viveros de café. Este es su segundo crédito con KIVA y se siente agradecido de recibir un apoyo apoyo financiero que le permite seguir adelante, por está razón se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Crispin, invertirá los S/.2500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Crispin is 55 years old, and married to Julia.  They have 7 children, but currently he lives only with his wife in their own home.  Crispin works in agriculture; he has 30 years of experience in cultivating avocados, bananas and other citrus fruits, and it has helped him acquire all that he has today.  In this way he has been able to set up local businesses in Lima, where one of his daughters lives, and it is there that he sends his avocados and bananas, into the largest market in the capital city.  

His 3 hectares of farmland give him the security that he will be able to always continue growing and care for and cultivate his plants well.  Growing coffee is very profitable and is one of the main products in his region, due to this almost all of the villagers work in cultivating coffee.  Julia saw a business opportunity in this, and because of her they cultivate coffee seedlings.

This is his 2nd loan with Kiva and he is very thankful to receive financial support that allows him to get ahead.  For this reason he promises to pay his quotas punctually.  Crispin will invest 2500 soles in buying organic fertilizer to nourish his seedlings.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 54 years old and married with five children.

Erlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling footware in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of footware to sell.

Erlinda has borrowed and paid back 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business buying and selling footware for 10 years and also earns an income from an internet cafe and a boarding house.

Erlinda aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of footware to sell.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is 49 years old, married with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Valentina has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her business.

Valentina has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumables like wheat flour, rice and cooking oil. She cites seasonality as her major challenge in the business. 

Margaret is requesting KES 15,000 to boost her kiosk by purchasing bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking oil. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking  oil.

loans.name: Saroeub's Group

texts.en:
A widowed mother of seven kids—two of whom are still in school, Saroeub is 53 years old and she grows rice and beans on two hectares as the main sources of her income. She can earn about 44,200 KHR per day and manages to save 19,900 KHR each day after the family’s expenses have been deducted.

This is the sixth microloan for Saroeub with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She has completely paid back the loans and they have helped her family to have decent food. Now she is leading two of her group members to ask for a loan in amount of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland. She hopes to gain more yield from her crops so as to extend her farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa es una señora de 37 años de edad casada, luchadora que día a día se levanta a sus quehaceres diarios como también a preparar la alimentación de sus 3 hijos para que asistan a la escuela y posteriormente en compañía de su esposo se dirigen a sus cultivos de café para dar mantenimiento y asistencia. Ella cuenta con tres años de educación primaria ya que no pudo seguir estudiando por la falta de apoyo económico por parte de sus padres. Fueron ellos los que le enseñaron a muy temprana edad a trabajar la tierra en lo que es maíz, frijol; pero principalmente café ya que es su única actividad por la cual reciben ingresos económicos. La tierra que ella y su esposo trabajan es propia gracias a una herencia familiar y está ubicada a 15 minutos de camino.

Elsa visito la cooperativa COMIXMUL para poder optar a un financiamiento con el cual ella podrá comprar insumos para poder darle mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café.

Su meta es poder comprar los insumos y proteger sus cultivos ya que muchas de sus necesidades dependen de la cosecha de café la cual están manteniendo segura y libre de plagas. Su sueño es poder apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios para que sean unos profesionales y tengan la herramienta que necesitan para ser personas emprendedoras en la vida.
texts.en:
Elsa is 37 years old, married, and a hard-worker who gets up fighting every single day to carry out her daily tasks. Her work starts with preparing meals for her three children who go to school, and then later, with her husband, she focuses on raising coffee to make their living. She has three years of primary education, but couldn't do any more as her parents could not economically support it. Her parents were the ones who taught her from a young age to work the land and grow corn, beans, and coffee above all, the latter crop being the only one that earns her family income. The land that she and her husband work is theirs thanks to a family inheritance, and it is located fifteen minutes from the road.

Elsa visited the COMIXMUL cooperative looking for financing, which she will use to purchase supplies that will help her in raising and growing coffee. Her goal is to be able to purchase these supplies and protect her crops, as all of the family's necessities depend on the coffee harvest being secure and free from disease. Her dream is to be able to support her children in their studies so that they can grow up and become professionals and have the tools they need to be life-long entrepreneurs.

loans.use: para la compra de insumos para el mantenimiento de sus cultivos de café.

loans.name: Liliana María

texts.es: Liliana es una mujer de 27 años de edad, es soltera y madre de 2 hijos. Se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas hace aproximadamente 2 años, inicialmente lo hacía en la acera de su casa y, hace 6 meses decidió arrendar un local para ejercer la actividad y vender comidas rápidas, fritos, jugos y gaseosas. Es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, se esmera por sacar adelante a su familia. Con el crédito desea comprar activos fijos (freidora, microondas, mesas, sillas) y adicionalmente desea comprar surtido (carnes frías, frutas, gaseosas, productos lácteos) con el fin que su negocio sea más agradable a la vista y permita llamar la atención de más clientes. Su principal sueño es hacer crecer su negocio, consolidándolo como uno de los más reconocidos del sector y así poder generar más ingresos para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a sus dos pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
Liliana, age 27, is single and has two children.  She has been selling fast food for approximately two years.  She initially sold on the sidewalk to her house.  Six months ago she decided to rent a place for her business activity and to sell fast food, fried food, juice, and soft drinks.  She is an enterprising  and hard-working woman.  She puts forth great effort to get her family ahead.

She wants to use the loan to buy fixed assets (fryer, microwaves, tables, chairs).  She also wishes to buy stock (cold meats, fruit, soft drinks, dairy products).  She will do this so that her business is more eye-appealing and will catch the attention of more customers.

Her main dream is to make her business grow and to strengthen it to become one of the most well-known in the sector.  This way she will be able to generate more income in order to give her two small children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fixed assets and stock.

loans.name: Banat Al Dayaa Group

texts.en:
Banat Al Dayaa is a group composed of three Lebanese friends, Nisrine, Randa and Amina They decided to join hands, form a group, trust each other and acquire a group loan from Al Majmoua in order to financially support each other. Each of them has a special financial need, and the loan would be a great advantage to pull them out of their situation. Nisrine is the leader and featured member of this group. She is a 30-year-old married mother of one child, standing in the center of the picture. She is currently unemployed but has farming skills, which also happens to be her hobby. Her husband is a soldier in the Lebanese army. Their combined monthly income is not sufficient to provide a healthy life for three individuals, which is why Nisrine decided to invest in her skills and start her own business. In fact, she decided to join the group and acquire a loan in order to purchase tomato seeds and farming materials. This will allow her to launch her own farm, and prepare "Mouneh" (food that is conserved from one season to the next). The farm would allow her family to have a better socioeconomic situation. 

Concerning the other group members, Randa is the woman standing on the right in the picture, while Amina is the woman standing on the left.

loans.use: to purchase tomato seeds and farming materials.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz nació en la ciudad Atalaya y tiene 48 años de edad, actualmente ella vive en la hermosa ciudad de Pilcopata junto con su pareja y con sus seis hijos y son muy felices, ella saca adelante a su familia  con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación pues su actividad económica principal es ayudar en el taller de carpintería de su esposo con el acabado de los muebles. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Kusacha de Pilcopata” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como madera. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. 

(El poblado de Pilcopata se destaca por el comercio de productos de la selva, así como servicios de alojamiento y restaurantes. Punto de ingreso al Parque Nacional del Manu.)
texts.en:
Beatriz was born in the city of Atalaya and is 48 years old. She currently lives with her spouse and their six children in the beautiful town of Pilcopata, and they are very happy. She drives her family forward with a great deal of hard work and dedication. Her primary work is helping in her husbands carpentry shop with the finishing of furniture. She has been doing this for a number of years and it goes very well thanks to the determination she puts into her work. 

She belongs to the communal bank "Kusacha de Pilcopata," and her moment of opportunity requires a loan, which she will use to purchase materials for the shop, such as wood. She is grateful for and values the loan highly, and she promises to responsibly repay the monthly agreements.

(The town of Pilcopata is noted for the sale of products from the jungle, as well as lodging and restaurant services. It is the main point of entry to Manu National Park.)

loans.use: purchase materials, such as wood, for her business.

loans.name: Cruz Marina

texts.es:
Cruz tiene 34 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene tres hijos. Desde hace 8 años se dedica al comercio informal de venta de ropa; aprendió este negocio por la necesidad de su familia de cubrir con los gastos del hogar, antes solo realizaba los oficios en su casa.

Ella compra la ropa por libra y la vende por unidad. La adquiere en la ciudad y debe pagar un vehiculo para trasladarlos hasta su casa, recorre aproximadamente 75 kilómetros.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar más cantidad de ropa. Debido a que sale a vender a diferentes cantones y necesita más ropa para llevar. Así, ella espera vender mas, para recibir ingresos que le permitan comprar el alimento a sus hijos. Su objetivo es,  instalar una tienda de ropa, para ya no andar de forma ambulante.
texts.en:
Cruz is 34 years old, and she has three children and a partner. For 8 years she has been selling clothing informally. She learned this business by necessity in order to cover household expenses. Before she was only doing domestic work. 

Cruz buys clothes by the pound and sells them in units. She gets the clothes in the city and must pay a vehicle to transport them approximately 75 kilometers to her house. 

The loan she is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy a higher quantity of clothing, given that she sells in different counties and she needs to bring more clothes. In this way, Cruz hopes to sell more, and to receive an income that helps her buy food for her children. Her goal is to establish a clothing store so that she no longer has to be a street vendor.

loans.use: buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Santos Gilberto

texts.es:
Santos tiene 45 años de edad, esta casado y tiene tres hijos. Ha trabajado la tierra desde los 13 años de edad; ya que la siembra de granos ha sido el trabajo y el sustento de su familia por años. Aprendió ayudándole a su padre. Su familia siempre se a dedicado a la siembra de granos básicos. Los insumos agrícolas los adquiere en la ciudad que esta a treinta minutos de su vivienda y los traslada en el autobús. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar abono, fertilizantes, herbicidas y pesticidas para su cultivo de maíz. Para el sustento de su familia ya q de allí obtiene el dinero para cubrir algunas necesidades de su hogar

Él desea, comprar mas ganado y sembrar mucho mas de esa manera obtener mas y mejores ingresos para que su familia tenga lo necesario.
texts.en:
Santos is 45 years old. He is married and has three children. He has worked the land since he was 13 years old, since growing grains has been the work and sustenance of his family for years. He learned by helping his father. His family has always grown staple grains. He obtains agricultural supplies in the city, which is thirty minutes from his house, and he transports them on the bus.

The loan he is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy manure, fertilizer, herbicide, and pesticide for his corn crop in order to support his family, since from it he obtains the money to cover some household necessities.

He wants to buy more cattle and plant a lot more, and in that way obtain more and better income so that his family will have what they need.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, herbicide, and pesticide for his corn crop

loans.name: Mahram

texts.ru: Махрам пожилая женщина в возрасте 63 лет. Она вдова. Имеет двух взрослых сыновей и одну дочь. Сыновья находятся за пределами Таджикистана, они выехали на заработки в Россию. Каждый месяц они присылают деньги своей матери на проживание. Дочь живет отдельно со своим мужем. А Махрам живет в своём доме с невестками и внуками. Внуки растут и расходы на нужды увеличиваются. Несмотря на то, что сыновья высылают деньги на проживание, их недостаточно для удовлетворения всех нужд семьи. Поэтому Махрам занимается своим маленьким бизнесом. Она покупает и продаёт овощи и фрукты. Махрам встает рано утром и покупает на оптовом рынке овощи или фрукты и перепродает их на центральном рынке своего района. От полученной выручки она откладывает необходимую сумму, а остальное тратит на покупку продуктов питания семье. Двое невесток тоже без дела не сидят, одна шьет на заказ платья дома, а другая реализует лапшу домашнего приготовления для местных столовых. Сейчас начался сезон для домашних закруток, поэтому спрос на овощи и фрукты увеличивается. В связи с этим Махрам хочет увеличить ассортимент своего товара, чтобы получить больше прибыли для своей семьи. Махрам обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит для закупа различных овощей и фруктов. Она благодарна за финансовую поддержку организации «Арванд».
texts.en: Mahram is an older woman, 63 years of age. She is a widow. She has two grown sons and one daughter. Her sons are currently outside Tajikistan; they are migrant workers in Russia. Every month their send some money to support their mother. Mahram’s daughter lives separately with her husband. As to Mahram, she lives in her home together with her daughters-in-law and grandchildren. The grandchildren are growing, and  the expenditures to cover their needs are increasing too. Even though Mahram's sons send some money, this is not enough to provide for all family needs. Therefore Mahram runs her own small business. She buys and resells fruits and vegetables. Mahram gets up early in the morning and buys vegetables or fruits at the wholesale market and then resells them at the central market of their region. She puts some of the money aside and spend the rest to buy food for her family. Her two daughters-in-law do not remain idle, either: one of them sews custom-made dresses, and the other sells homemade noodles to local cafeterias. At present it is the season to make household purchases, which is why the demand for vegetables and fruits is increasing. Therefore Mahram would like to expand her stock and earn larger revenues for her family. Mahram has applied to Arvand for a loan to stock up on various vegetables and fruits. She thanks Arvand for its financial support.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Loel

texts.en:
Loel is a widower and blessed with three children. He currently cultivates his one-hectare rice field and has been in the farming business for 17 years.  He is grateful that through his patience and determination, he was able to provide for the needs of his family, especially the education of his children.  

To further make his business grow, he would like to borrow PHP 30,000 that he can use for the maintenance of his farm.  He will make use of the loan in purchasing farm supplies for his rice field.  He believes that having additional capital will enable him to have a continuous flow of crop production. 

Loel hopes and prays that his requested loan amount will be approved by the lenders. He is also hoping that his income will increase for the welfare of his family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia es una mujer de 59 años de edad, soltera y madre cabeza de hogar. Tiene 4 hijos a los cuales ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación. Se dedica a la producción y venta de arepas hechas de forma artesanal, asadas al carbón y las vende en el sector donde reside. Su producto ha gustado tanto que ahora no alcanza a producir toda la cantidad que requiere para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, ya que trabaja sola. El crédito lo desea invertir en la compra de un molino eléctrico, un mesón en acero inoxidable, ollas grandes, maíz y carbón al por mayor para agilizar su proceso de producción y poder cumplir con los requerimientos de sus clientes. Su mayor sueño es hacer crecer su negocio y convertirla en una fábrica de arepas que sea muy bien organizada y reconocida, con el fin de aumentar sus ingresos y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Alicia is 59 years old, a single mother, and the head of her household. She has four children whom she has been able to push forward with a great deal of hard work and dedication.  She works in the production and sale of arepas, a type of thick corn tortilla, which she makes in the traditional way, grilled over charcoal, and sells in her neighborhood. Her arepas are so well liked that she cannot make enough of them to meet her customers' demands, since she works by herself. This loan will be used to invest in the purchase of an electric grinder, a stainless steel counter top, large pots, and the wholesale purchase of corn and charcoal. These will speed up her production process and let her meet the demands of her customers.

Her greatest dream is to grow her business into an arepas factory, one that would be both well run and well known, with the goal of increasing her income and bringing a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: purchase an electric grinder, a stainless steel counter, large pots, corn, and charcoal at wholesale.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel se dedica a la venta de diferentes verduras regionales como cebolla, papa, tomates, plátanos y frutas como papayas, maracuyá entre otros, por esta razón tiene un pequeño puesto al frente de su hogar. Gracias a su esfuerzo tiene éxito en su negocio. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede conversar con sus clientes a quienes atiende de manera amable y cordial,  más adelante espera tener una tienda muy grande donde pueda vender sus verduras y abarrotes con mayor comodidad. Isabel agradece la oportunidad que le brinda Kiva para continuar con su negocio además se compromete a ser responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto de S/. 600  comprará más verduras y frutas tales como cebolla, papa, tomates, plátanos, papayas, maracuyá entre otros ya que desea surtir su puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Isabel makes a living selling various regional vegetables such as onions, potatoes, tomatoes, and plantains, and fruits such as papaya, passion fruit, and others.  She has a small place for this in front of her house.  Thanks to her effort she's successful in her business.

What she likes about her job is she can talk to her customers, whom she serves kindly and cordially.  Later she hopes to have a large store for selling vegetables and groceries more easily.

Isabel's grateful for the opportunity from Kiva to continue with her business.  She also promises to be responsible in making her payments.

With the requested amount of 600 nuevos soles [PEN] she'll buy more onions, potatoes, tomatoes, papaya, passion fruit, and other fruits and vegetables because she wants to stock her sales stall.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
Julián, de 56 años de edad , vive en compañía de su esposa Rosa, ambos tienen 5 hijos, pero solo viven con una de ellas en su casa propia. Julián se dedica a la ganaderia y agricultura, todas las mañanas cuida a sus vacas, las que le proporcionan muchos litros de leche. Como tiene extensas áreas verdes, mucho espacio y sobre todo pastos naturales que él mismo siembra le sale muy rentable tener estos animales. Además como buen agricultor tambien siembra diversos alimentos que comercializa en su misma zona. Ahora desea mejorar la raza de sus animales pues desea tener vacas lecheras de buena calidad que le produzcan más litros de leche para su comercio. Este es su segundo crédito con KIVA, agradece la oportunidad de progreso que le brindaron en su anterior crédito. Por esa razón promete ser puntual en sus cuotas, ya que le ayudó a mejorar en su negocio.
Julian, invertirá los S/.600 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos de alfalfa.
texts.en:
Julián, 56 years old, lives with his wife Rosa. They have five children, but only one of them still lives at home with them. Julián's line of work is ranching and agriculture. Every morning he gets up to care for his cows, who yield him many liters of milk. As he has large green areas, a lot of space, and above all, natural grasses that he planted himself, having these animals is very profitable. Also, like any good farmer, he plants a variety of feed crops on his land as well. 

He now wants to improve the stock of his animals. Specifically, he wants high-quality milking cows that will produce even more liters of milk for him to sell. This is his second KIVA loan. He is thankful for the opportunity for progress that his previous loan gave him. For that reason, he promises to be punctual in his repayments, as they are what is helping him improve his business.

Julián will invest S/.600 soles in the purchase of organic fertilizers to feed his alfalfa plantings.

loans.use: purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Isidro Candelario

texts.es:
Isidro es un señor Dinámico para las actividades comerciales,  de profesión  Comerciante Mayorista ofrece diversidad de tipos Productos de consumo Básico en un mercado de la cuidad donde habita, es casado, actualmente tiene la necesidad de un financiamiento para utilizarlo en la compra de  frijoles, maíz, arroz, azúcar, aceite, trigo, semolina y cacao y poder cubrir la demanda existente debido a esto visito las oficinas de ceprodel para ser beneficiado y poder lograr el objetivo percibido y de esa manera mejorar las condiciones  de vida  en su seno familiar.

Agradeciéndole a  ceprodel por la oportunidad de crédito y por el apoyo que le brindan a estos sectores que tanto necesitan para poderse desarrollar.
texts.en:
Isidro is a gentleman who is dynamic in business activities. He is a wholesale dealer by profession. He offers diverse types of basic consumer products in a market in the city where he lives. He is married. Currently he needs a loan to buy beans, corn, rice, sugar, oil, wheat, semolina, and cacao to be able to cover the existing demand. Because of this, he visited Ceprodel's offices in order to benefit and be able to achieve the perceived goal, and in that way improve his family's living conditions.

He thanks Ceprodel for the loan opportunity and for the support they give to those areas that need it so much in order to be able to develop.

loans.use: to buy beans, corn, rice, sugar, oil, wheat, semolina, and cacao

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es: Cecilia tiene 41 años, está casada y vive en su casa propia junto su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Cecilia se dedica a la repostería, actividad que aprendió estudiando en un centro de educación ocupacional, llegando a tener muchos pedidos por el buen trabajo que realiza y continúa actualizándose. Cuando no tiene pedidos considerables realiza la venta en su casa en donde exhibe sus productos en una vitrina. Hace 2 años empezó su negocio y se mantiene estable. Le gusta  la repostería, se siente a gusto con su oficio pues le ha proporcionado muchas satisfacciones, como los ingresos económicos y el poder convertirse  en una prospera empresaria, por eso tiene planes de abrir una fuente de soda en su casa, ya que su ubicación en una esquina es estratégica para un buen negocio. En este préstamo con Kiva se siente emocionada al saber que hay personas que le brindan un respaldo económico para continuar desarrollando su negocio, así mismo se compromete a ser una socia puntual y responsable. Con el monto de S/. 1500 comprará ingredientes para la preparación de sus postres como azúcar, harina, huevos y otros, así mismo comprará moldes y utensilios de repostería.
texts.en:
Cecilia is 41 years old, married, and lives in her own house along with her husband and their three children.  Cecilia makes a living in a confectionery, which she learned while studying at an occupational education center.  She has come to have many orders for the good work that she did and continues to do.  When she does not have large orders, she sells from her house where she displays her products in a glass case.  It has been two years since she began her business and she keeps it stable.  She likes the confectionery and feels comfortable with her job since it has provided her many satisfactions, like an income and being able to become a successful businesswoman.  That is why she has plans to open a soda fountain in her house, as her corner location is strategic for good business.

With this Kiva loan she is excited to know that there are people offering her financial support to continue developing her business.  Meanwhile, she promises to be a punctual and responsible member.  With the amount of 1,500 PEN she will buy ingredients for making her cakes like sugar, flour, eggs, and others.  She will also buy cake tins and confectionery utensils.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing cakes as part of her business.

loans.name: Celina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Celina tiene 28 años de edad, es una madre soltera de una niña de 9 años de edad. ella se ha crecido con sus abuelos pues sus padres murieron en la guerra civil que hubo en el país.  Desde pequeña  ha luchado muy duro para ver de ganar para la comida diaria, estudios en el nivel básico hasta séptimo grado. Luego tuvo que irse a trabajar a la ciudad en un comedor y también lavaba, planchaba en la comunidad a personas ajenas. Hoy en día con muchos esfuerzos esta estudiando a distancia y ya esta en el nivel secundario, los fines de semana se va ha estudiar, gracias también a un tío que le ayuda con algunos gastos del instituto.

Con esfuerzos  ha logrado construir una casa de bloque, pues siempre había soñado vivir aparte con su hija. Trabaja en pequeña escala en la agricultura y hoy esta aprendiendo hacer huertos caseros (hortalizas)

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar arena, cemento y pago de mano de obra,  para fraguar por dentro de la casa y tener el piso encementado, y con el tiempo poder enladrillarla, también invertirá en la construcción de una cocina de bahareque y de tablas, para tener la cocina, a la par de la casa.

Con el financiamiento,  tendrá una mejor comodidad, a la vez con la cocina  evitara de cierta manera padecer de enfermedades respiratorias.

ella sueña poco a poco ir mejorando la vivienda, pues aun le hace falta un muro de contención y una cerca perimetral y  terminar sus estudios y seguir apoyando a su hija.
texts.en:
Celina is 28 years old and the single mother of a 9-year-old daughter. She grew up with her grandparents, as her parents died in her country's civil war. Ever since she was very young, she has fought hard to earn her living. She went to school through the seventh grade, but after that she had to go and work in the city. She worked first in a diner, and she also washed and ironed clothing for other people in the community. Today, after a lot of hard work, she is enrolled in distance learning and she's up to the high school level. On the weekends, she goes to school, thanks in part to an uncle who is helping her with some of the school's expenses.

Through her hard work, she has managed to build a cinder block home. It has always been her dream to live on her own with her daughter. She also works in small-scale agriculture, and is learning to make vegetable gardens.

She is requesting this loan through Fundación Campo, which will be used to pay for sand, cement, and labor costs towards pouring a concrete floor in her home. In time, she will be able to pave it in bricks. She will also invest in the construction of a daub-and-wattle / wood frame kitchen, which will go alongside her home.

With this loan, her home will be more convenient. By having the kitchen, she will be able to avoid suffering from a variety of respiratory illnesses.  She dreams of improving her home, a little at a time; she is still missing a containing wall and a perimeter fence. She also wants to finish her studies and continue to support her daughter.

loans.use: pour a concrete floor in her home and build a kitchen

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz de 39 años, está casada con Orlando con quien tiene 2 hijos , juntos viven en su casa propia. Luz es una mujer responsable y confiable. Hace más de 10 años se dedica a la elaboración de cajones de madera, para contener frutas, para ello utiliza diferentes árboles como son: el cedro, el nogal, las paltas y el pino. Además, con el tiempo fue ampliando su taller (ubicado detrás de su vivienda), y ahora también construye muebles como mesas, sillas, o simplemente se encarga de vender tablas de maderas. El negocio es rentable, con todos los ahorros obtenidos, consiguió abrir otro negocio en su mismo hogar, donde vende algunos comestibles.
“El negocio de los cajones es rentable, porque los pedidos que me hacen son por millares, ésta semana debo vender 2 millares de cajones sólo  aun comprador”, menciona. Ella requiere de su apoyo, ya que tiene que cubrir éste pedido y necesita de capital para adquirir más madera. Este es su segundo crédito con KIVA y agradece el apoyo financiero recibido ya que le permite seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Luz, invertirá los S/.2000 soles en la compra de madera par la elaboración de cajones, donde se colocan las frutas.
texts.en:
Luz, 39 years old, is married to Orlando, with whom she has 2 children. They live together in their own house. Luz is a responsible and reliable woman. More than 10 years ago, she started making wooden crates to hold fruit. For that, she uses wood from different trees such as cedar, walnut, avocado, and pine. Also, over time she expanded her workshop (located behind her house), and now she also makes furniture such as tables and chairs, or simply sells the wooden boards. The business is profitable, and with all the savings obtained she was able to open another business in her home where she sells some food items.

"The crate business is profitable, because the orders they place with me are for thousands, this week I have to sell two thousand crates to only one buyer," she notes. She needs your support, since she has to cover this order and she needs capital to acquire more wood. This is her second loan with Kiva, and she is thankful for the financial support received, since it allows her to continue moving forward. She also promises to make her repayments in a punctual manner. 

Luz will use the 2000 soles to buy wood to make crates to hold fruit.

loans.use: to buy wood to make crates

loans.name: Luisito

texts.en:
Luisito is from Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 36 years old. Luisito is married and has two children. To make a living, Luisito owns and operates a bicycle transport service. Luisito has been engaged in his business for some years and earns PHP 4,000 per month for these activities. 

Luisito is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000, which will be used to buy a raincoat, accessories and tires to give a better service. In 2011, Luisito joined GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy a raincoat, accessories and tires to give a better service.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 54-year-old married father of four children. He owns a tractor that he rides across the fields of his village in order to prepare the lands to be harvested, which is how he earns his living. He has been working in this field for 40 years now. His wife is currently unemployed, two of his children work, and one is enrolled in a public school. However, even with three family members working, the family income is very low and insufficient to provide for the family. 

Hassan decided to acquire a loan from Al Majmoua because his older son is getting married soon, and he does not have the sufficient funds to prepare the ceremony. The loan would allow him to invest his revenue in other family expenses, instead of spending it all on the wedding.

loans.use: to prepare his son's wedding ceremony.

loans.name: Hilda Lucia

texts.es:
Hilda , tiene 35 años, de estado civil casada, vive en Guaranda, provincia de Bolívar vive con sus tres hijos y su esposo.

La VRC Arte y Cultura  “Wari” se encuentra en la comunidad de Larkaloma a 45 minutos  de la oficina, está conformada por 11 socios.

Hilda se dedica  a la agricultura, siembre de papas y cría animales ganado y pollos.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semilla de papas, pollos y vacas, fertilizantesn urea, lìquidos para la maleza y así poder tener un propio negocio , las compras y las ventas  lo hace en Guaranda  de forma semanal.

Su sueño es tener un vehículo propio, ya que los desafíos a los se enfrentan diariamente son las malas vías de comunicación.

Su tiempo libre la dedica a tejar ropa de lana.
texts.en:
Hilda is 35 years old, married, and lives in Guaranda, in Bolívar province. She lives with her husband and three children.

The Art and Culture Communal Bank "Wari" is located in the community of Larkaloma, about 45 minutes from the office, and is comprised of eleven members.

Hilda works in agriculture, planting potatoes and raising cattle and chickens. 

She is requesting this loan to purchase seed potatoes, cows and chickens, fertilizers and urea, and liquid herbicides, such that she can have her own business. She does her buying and selling in Guaranda on a weekly basis.

Her dream is to have her own vehicle, since many of the challenges she faces on a daily basis are due to the poor means of travel.  In her spare time, she weaves wool clothing.

loans.use: purchase seed potatoes, chickens, cows, fertilizers and urea, and herbicides.

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en: Immaculee is 43 years old. She is married with seven children aged between 11 and 22. They are all enrolled in schools. She sells vegetables and has spent two years in the business. With the loan, she wants to buy more vegetables for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce a married woman and has been blessed with one child. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 16 years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumables like wheat flour, rice and cooking oil. She cites seasonality as her major challenge in the business. 

She is requesting a loan of KES 40,000 to boost her kiosk, purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 21-year-old single man who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He operates a cell phone accessory stall. He has been involved in this kind of business for two years. He started his business with a little bit of capital, enough to open his business. He is hardworking and has good dealings with his clients. 

He would like to ask for financial assistance, so he has applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB. The loan will be used to buy more cell phone accessories and rechargeable phone cards for his business. He believes that he can increase his income to be able to cover his family's needs and become a successful entrepreneur someday.

loans.use: to buy more cell phone accessories and rechargeable phone cards for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy paper and ink for her husband's printing business.

loans.name: Subhiyi

texts.en:
Subhiyi is a 59 year-old married mother of seven children. For a living, she harvests olive trees, thyme leaves, vine leaves, and many other kinds of plants. Following the harvest, she turns the olives and the leaves into edible products, sells them or conserves them as a "Mouneh" (food that is conserved from one season to the other). She has been working in this field for 25 years now. Her husband is a concierge, and three of her underage children work. 

However, even with five family members working, the family income is extremely low and is in no way sufficient to provide for a family of 9 individuals. Furthermore, Subhiyi did not have the opportunity as a child or even as an adult to acquire a proper education, because of her economic situation and that of her late parents. She is illiterate, which has been a great handicap in her life, and she wishes to be able to send her children back to school so that they can have a better life. However, it is nearly impossible considering the poverty they live in. 

Thus, Subhiyi contacted Al Majmoua in order to acquire a loan, that would help her maintain the balcony where she sells her output, and would help her finance a "Mouneh" and seeds. As for the future, Subhiyi wishes to open up her own store where she would sell and trade what she harvests.

loans.use: to maintain the balcony where she sells her output and help her finance making mouneh and seeds.

loans.name: Eliu

texts.es: Eliu, de 52 años, está casado y vive en su casa propia con su esposa y una de sus hijas. Eliu se dedica a la venta de gaseosas y cervezas. Tiene una refrigeradora y una congeladora que usa para que las bebidas se encuentren en su punto ideal de congelación al momento que empiezan a llegar sus clientes. Trabaja en esta actividad generalmente en las tardes, durante las mañanas trabaja en un aserradero cercano a su vivienda. Tiene este negocio por más que 2 años y le brinde ingresos para ayudar con los gastos de su hogar.Le gusta su trabajo ya que tiene tiempo a su disposición para desarrollar cómodamente otras actividades, además la acogida de la clientela que tiene por la alta temperatura que caracteriza el lugar donde vive le asegura buenas ventas a diario. Tiene muchos planes a futuro pero por el momento le gustaría agrandar su negocio en su casa. En este préstamo con Kiva, está muy contenta de saber que tiene apoyo financiero, y por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Con el monto de S/. 500 comprará bebidas de diversas marcas y tamaños ya que desea surtir su tienda con mayor variedad de productos.
texts.en: Fifty-two-year-old Eliu is married and lives in his own home with his wife and one of his daughters.  Eliu sells soft drinks and beer for a living.  He has a refrigerator and a freezer that he uses so that his drinks are at the ideal level of refrigeration when his customers arrive.  He usually does this work in the afternoon; during the morning he works at a sawmill near his home.  He has had this business for over two years and it provides him with income to help with the household expenses.  He likes his work as he still has time to do other things, and the welcome he receives from his customers because of the hot climate where he lives guarantees him good daily sales.  He has many plans for the future, but at the moment he would like to expand his home business.  He is very happy to know that with this Kiva loan he has financial support and he also promises once again to make his payments on time.  He likes being a part of his communal bank because all of its members are responsible and very supportive people.  With the 500 soles, he will buy different brands and sizes of drinks, as he wants to stock his store with a wider variety of products.

loans.use: to buy drinks to stock his store

loans.name: Georges

texts.en:
Georges is a 63-year-old married man living with his wife and three children. Despite his older age, he is still working to support his family financially. He owns an electrical generator by which he provides neighboring citizens with electrical power. He has fair number of customers. 

Performing maintenance on the generator and filling it with required fuel are very pricey. That’s why today Georges is requesting to take a loan from Kiva's partner, Vitas s.a.l., so as to purchase the needed quantity of fuel to be able to carry on with his operations properly and constantly. 

In the future, Georges plans to pass on his profession to one of his children and confirms that he will keep on supervising his work closely as he worked very hard over 20 years to reach what he has attained so far.

loans.use: to purchase the needed quantity of fuel.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 41 years old. She is married and they were gifted with six children. She is engaged in a fish-vending business.  

She wishes to make her business grow by having more fish to sell. To do this, she is now asking for the financial assistance of the lenders and would like to borrow a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy more fish to sell.  

She hopes that her business will become profitable so she can provide for the growing needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of flour, sugar and cooking oil for her bakery business

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is a married woman and has six children. She is 48 years old and resides in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Estrella operates a fishing business venture, selling seafood products, including crabs and shrimp to the local community to earn a living and she's been in this business for three years. 

Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of work. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. 

In the future, Estrella hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing equipment, including hooks and nets.

loans.name: Jennyville

texts.en:
Jennyville is a farmer from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She has been in the farming business for several years now. This is the source of her income.

Jennyville is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve her farm as well as her harvest. Jennyville hopes of making her business a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a 49 year old married woman and the mother of two children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has been engaged in the rice farming business for more than 8 years. This is the source of her income.

Josefina is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve her farm as well as her harvest. In the future, Josefina hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Ellaine

texts.en:
Ellaine works hard to support her family. Ellaine is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

Ellaine requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Ellaine has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Ellaine would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Precilla

texts.en:
Precilla is 44 years old and married with two children.

Precilla works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Precilla has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell charcoal business for ten years and also earns an income from a restaurant.

Precilla aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman aged 50. She has six kids, all of whom still attend school. She lives in a house that neither has electricity not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Margaret operates a stall selling fruits and vegetables. She sells in the market to town-dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of competition and seasonality in her business. 

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fruits like oranges and bananas and green vegetables for resale. She dreams of expanding and establishing a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits including oranges and bananas and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Donathile

texts.en: Donathile is 43 years old. She is a widow taking care of one orphan who is seven years old. She sells fabrics and threads. With the loan, she wants to buy more fabric for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: To buy more fabric for sale.

loans.name: Kanze

texts.en:
Kanze is married and has one kid. She lives at a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Kanze operates a polythene selling business to earn a living and support her family. She cites competition and seasonality in her business to be her major challenge 

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase 12 bunches of polythene bags for resale. She dreams of expanding and establishing a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase 12 bunches of the polythene bags for resale.

loans.name: Buhumuriro Group

texts.en:
The story is for Gabriel--the gentle man with a book in the hand at the front.

Gabriel is 38, married, and has 6 children. He lives in rural Kagadi. He is a farmer and trader buying mainly maize and beans as his major source of income. He also grows coffee and tomatoes as an additional source of income to look after his family.

Gabriel wants a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda Shillings (UGX) to add into his produce trade business so that he can get more returns from the business this season. It's now the harvest season and yet his income is low; he believes if he invests the money from the loan his returns will be high. His dream is to buy a motor vehicle to ease the transportation of his produce to the market and reduce the cost of hiring, therefore increasing profit.

However, Gabriel is always challenged by the limited capital in his business as well as the price fluctuations for agricultural products on the market. He is a hard working man who is committed to seeing his fellow group members' livelihoods transformed.

loans.use: To buy maize and beans for resale

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Aminata is 49 years old and widowed with 8 children. Two of her children are going to school. She runs a palm oil business in Kandeh town Bo, in Sierra Leone. She started her business when she lost her husband.

She's been in this business for 10 years and sells palm oil from her home. She does not have any other source of income except her business. She says that at present her business is doing well because she is able to feed her children with the profit.

Aminata requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more palm oil to expand her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her standard of living and take care of her childrens' welfare. In the future, she would like to change her business to expand her business. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Cindy Lorenia

texts.es: Cindy es una mujer de 25 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Ha realizado diversos cursos de manualidades por lo que se dedica a hacer  manteles, centros de mesa, mantas para bebé, entre otras cosas, que posteriormente las vende a sus conocidos y vecinos del sector donde reside. Es una joven luchadora y comprometida, trabaja de lunes a domingo y se esmera por cumplirle a sus clientes. El crédito lo desea invertir en la compra de insumos (telas, agujas, hilos) para poder hacer los encargos que tiene pendientes y de esta forma, poder satisfacer los requerimientos de sus clientes. Su mayor sueño es tener una tienda de regalos que sea reconocida en su ciudad y de esta forma poder aumentar sus ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cindy is 25 years old. She is single and has no children. She has pursued various types of handicrafts and principally makes tablecloths, centerpieces, and baby blankets, among other things. She then sells these products to her acquaintances and neighbors. She is a hard-working, committed woman who works from Monday to Sunday and drives herself to complete her customers' orders. 

The loan will be used to invest in supplies such as fabric, needles and thread, so that she can complete her pending orders and satisfy her customers' requests.  Her dream is to open a gift shop that is well recognized in the city and by doing so, increase her income as well as her quality of life.

loans.use: purchase supplies such as fabric, needles, and thread.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 56 year-old married father of five children. He owns a small business where he maintains electric wares and cars. His wife is currently unemployed, which makes him the only financial resource of the family. Two of his children are enrolled in private schools, and the three others are enrolled in public schools to provide them with a good education--an opportunity Hussein was unable to acquire since the highest education he ever got was intermediate. However, this also means that he has to settle the schooling expenses on top of all their other family expenses. 

Hussein contacted Al Majmoua to get a loan in order to maintain his house and purchase doors for his living room. As for the future, Hussein wishes to purchase merchandise and work kits in order to enhance his business.

loans.use: to maintain his house and purchase doors for his living room

loans.name: Maya

texts.en: Maya is a 30-year-old married woman living with her husband and only child. She has worked as a hairdresser since 2005. She works on a freelance basis visiting customers wherever they reside. With her requested youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l., she will purchase beauty products and hair remover machinery. She has high demands on her talented services and that's why she aims to improve her business continually in order to always satisfy her customer's demands. In the future, Maya confirms that she will request additional Kiva loans because her subsequent step is to become the owner of a proper beauty salon.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products and hair remover machinery

loans.name: Mercy

texts.es: Mercy tiene 26 años, está casada, y vive en casa de sus padres con su familia. Mercy, se dedica a la venta de bebidas de distintas marcas y sabores variados con los que sus clientes se refrescan. Tiene un congelador entregado por la empresa de bebidas con la que trabaja en donde coloca a diario las cervezas y gaseosas que vende durante el día en su casa. Sus clientes principalmente son sus vecinos, amigos y familiares. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que puede disponer de su tiempo libre, además desea incrementar la cantidad de productos que ofrece ya que considera que le genera muy buenas ganancias económicas debido a que su punto de ventas se encuentra en una zona muy concurrida. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segunda de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Manifiesta estar feliz en este grupo ya que es una socia antigua que brinda toda su experiencia a los nuevos integrantes. Con el monto solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de bebidas para que continúe trabajando.
texts.en: Mercy is 26 years old, married, and lives at her parents' house with her family.  Mercy sells different brands and flavors of refreshing drinks for a living.
