Зеби женщина средних лет, замужняя, имеет четверых детей.  Живет в Гафуровском районе.  Она более тридцати лет работает на химчистке. Её муж занимается сельскими работами, у него есть земля, занимается рисоводством.   В семье сейчас семь человек, у Зеби два сына и две дочери, старшая дочь вышла замуж, старший сын тоже женат, имеет одного ребенка, работает на стройке.   Младший сын в этом году закончил школу. 
 У Зеби большой дом, и она хочет   отремонтировать его так как очень долгое время не ремонтировали. Дом в плохом состоянии.  Но для этого  нужны денежные средства, а наличность у них мало, так как в мае её муж потратил деньги на посев риса, а урожай будет в октябре.   Поэтому Зеби решила получить  кредит, купить строительные материалы и  отремонтировать дом. Заранее благодарит Арванд за осуществление ее планов.
texts.en:
Zebi is a middle aged woman; she is married and has four children and lives in the Gafurov district. She has worked as a dry-cleaner for over thirty years. Her husband is a farmer; he has land where he grows rice. The family now has seven members: Zebi's two sons and two daughters, the elder daughter's husband, and the wife and child of the eldest son, who works in construction. The younger son is finishing high school this year. 

Zebi has a large house, and she would like to do some repairs, since upkeep hasn't been done in a very long time. The house is in bad condition, but to fix it will require money, and they don't have much extra since in May Zebi's husband spent money on rice planting, and the harvest will be in October. For that reason Zebi decided to request a loan to buy building materials and repair the house. She thanks you in advance for bringing her plans to fruition.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is aged 30 years and is a resident of Nsumbi a Kampala City suburb.  He has two children who are both in school.  Joseph studied up to secondary level but could not continue because of a lack of tuition.

Joseph has a retail shop business that he started in 2010 with the aim of improving on his daily income and which is located in a busy trading centre.  

Joseph's major customers are mostly the neighbors and people from different areas. He is assured of market and has all the experience to succeed in this business. However, he faces challenges of competition, inadequate capital and at times changes in the market prices. 

Joseph obtained a loan of ugx.1,000,000/= in order to purchase more stock of the products that are in high demand from his business in order to meet the needs of his customers in the market.

Joseph’s dream is to become a big trader through acquiring more loans as a simple source of income for him.

loans.use: to buy retail stock.

loans.name: Fany Del Carmen

texts.es:
Fany del Carmen habita en el municipio de El Sauce, un poblado ubicado al occidente del departamento de León rodeado en esta temporada de invierno de montañas florecidas donde prevalece el aroma natural de las flores y de ríos caudalosos donde prevalece el agua cristalina.

En este bello pueblo predomina lo turístico por sus paisajes atractivos.

Fany se siente muy orgullosa de haber nacido en esta maravillosa tierra y fue aquí donde tuvo a su primer y única hija a la cual le inculca lo tradicional de su pueblo y las costumbres pueblerinas.

Se recibió como contadora y desde hace más de veinte años se desempeña como tal en una empresa de la localidad. Con su salario ha mejorado su vivienda y ha tratado de darle a su hija lo mejor que puede en cuanto a educación.

Actualmente está solicitando un crédito en Ceprodel para que con el apoyo de los inversionistas de Kiva lo financien el cual lo requiere para Compra de medicina, realización de ultrasonidos y pago de consultas médicas con el fin de mejorar su salud ya que se ha sentido mal.

Espera con gran fe que estas personas apoyen su solicitud para llevar a cabo su inversión.
texts.en:
Fany del Carmen lives in the city of El Sauce in the western section of León department. During the winter season, the nearby mountains are covered by naturally scented flowers, and crystal-clear water runs in the rivers. The beautiful landscapes make tourism the main business in this community. Fany is proud to be a native of this marvelous area. She gave birth to her only child, a daughter, here, and she has educated her in the community's traditions and customs. 

Fany received a degree in accounting and has worked in this profession for a local business for 20 years. She has used her salary to renovate her home and to give her daughter the best education she could afford.

She has applied to Ceprodel for a Kiva loan to buy medicine and to pay for an ultrasound and medical appointments so that she can improve her poor health. She has great faith that her loan will be approved so that she can make this investment.

loans.use: to buy medicine and to pay for an ultrasound and medical appointments.

loans.name: Asmahan

texts.en:
Asmahan is a 55-year-old single woman, who is well known in her region because of her experience and excellent business management.  She has been selling wood furniture and souvenirs since 1991.  She also designs and sells special hand-made crafts for occasions such as births, engagements, and weddings.  She is also a tailor, so her shop is very broad, and she splits it into departments; each part is for a certain business, but at the same time, they are in one place but blended in a beautiful and smart way.

Asmahan has been an Al Majmoua borrower for eight cycles, and her business has improved a lot with the help of Al Majmoua loans, which she has invested in adding a certain product to her shop each time.

She is a hardworking woman.  She is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to increase her business merchandise with special home products and wooden souvenirs that will attract customers' attention and increase her revenue.

She is still working hard and hoping to open a larger shop in the future with a big showroom for her handmade souvenirs.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with special home products and wooden souvenirs.

loans.name: Tahreer

texts.en:
Tahreer is 24-years-old and from Nablus.  She is married and has one child.

She owns a small farm for raising cattle and selling dairy and cheese in the market.  

She asked Kiva partner Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy more cattle for her farm.  Through this loan Tahreer will be able to increase the productivity and thus improve her income.

The one who appears in the picture is Tahreer's husband since she refused to take a picture due to cultural norms.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for her farm

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is 35-years-old, married and she supports three members of her family.  She has two children aged eight and four years-old respectively.  She has been doing tailoring for a period of over ten years and has a monthly income of KES 20,000.

She is now servicing her third term loan of KES 45,000 from Kiva partner KADET LTD and she intends to use this amount in order to purchase textile materials to make more clothes to sell. The anticipated profits will be used to pay school fees for her children.

Priscilla's dream is to prosper in her business.

loans.use: to purchase textiles in order to make clothes.

loans.name: Aram

texts.en:
Aram is 28 years old.  He lives with his small family in Gavar, which is in the Gegharkunik region. Aram is married and has two children. His wife is a nurse and she works at the local poli-clinics. Aram has no higher education and he does some building and repairing work. Nevertheless, the main income of their family comes from farming.  Aram is engaged in pig breeding. He has ten pigs, and the profit from meat selling is more than his monthly salary.  Aram sells his farm product in different ways.  Sometimes he sells it right from their house through resellers or he sells it to the local butchers.
Aram hopes very much that through Kiva lenders he can enlarge the number of his farm animals and he asks a loan of 500.000 Armenian drams to buy several pigs.

loans.use: To buy several pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients to make cakes.

loans.name: Farhat

texts.en: Farhat, age 35, is a married woman and a mother of five. She has successfully built an academy in her home. Previously, she took a loan to purchase furniture for her academy to accommodate more students. Over time, she has attained a good number of students and earns a good amount of profit through her business to meet her household expenses. Currently, she requested a new loan of Rs 25,000 to buy a couple tables and chairs with a new blackboard. She is in her fifth loan cycle with a good repayment history. She is very experienced and wishes to expand her academy in the near future.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs and a new blackboard.

loans.name: Vasiliy

texts.ru:
Василий уже несколько раз пользовался кредитами Кива. Благодаря предыдущим кредитам Василий смог расширить ассортимент продукции на новом торговом месте.
В этот раз Василий планирует использовать полученную финансовую помощь в размере 11 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить наручные, настенные и электронные часы под реализацию, тем самым далее расширяя свой бизнес.
texts.en: Vasiliy has already received loans from KIVA several times. Thanks to previous loans Vasiliy was able to expand his inventory at a new market stall. This time Vasiliy plans to use the funds he is requesting, 11,000 Hryvnia, to buy watches, clocks, and digital clocks to further expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase watches and digital clocks

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 31 years of age, widowed, and has two children. She has a food stall business that she has been running for four years in Kitengela town. 

This will be her first loan term with KADET LTD, and she plans to buy more stock of food supplies for use in her business. These include milk, sugar, beans, maize, flour and rice. She will use the anticipated profits to buy a piece of land.

She hopes to grow her business, make more income and be able to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock of food supplies.

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en: Angelique is age 33. She sells ladies clothes and has been in the business for a half year. She has recently changed from selling vegetables to clothes. With the loan, she wants to buy more shirts and skirts for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make savings.

loans.use: To buy more shirts and skirts for sale.

loans.name: Hala

texts.en: Hala is a 40 year-old hardworking mother of three sons. Her husband is a taxi driver, while she works in her mini-bus sending kids to school and bringing them back home at the end of the day.   Besides using the bus as a school bus for other kids, she wants to use her free time in the afternoon distributing goods to be able to cover her sons' and the family's needs.  She applied for this loan to first do some repairing to the bus and second to start a business and bring some home gadgets and products to sell.

loans.use: to first do some repairing to the bus and bring some home gadgets and products to sell.

loans.name: Najwa

texts.en: Najwa is a 36 year-old mother of six children.   Having a big family makes it difficult for her husband to cover all their needs, so she applied for this loan to start a beauty salon at home and start selling make up and cosmetics products, beauty tools and hair styling tools.

loans.use: to start a beauty salon at home and start selling make up and cosmetics products, beauty tools and hair styling tools.

loans.name: Jameel

texts.en: Jameel is 51 years old and is from Ramallah.  He is married and has one child.  He has owned a small local restaurant selling traditional food like humus and falafel since 2009.  He asked Ryada for this loan in order to develop his restaurant and buy some chairs, tables, and a refrigerator for his local falafel restaurant.  He hopes that this loan will help him increase his customers, and thus improve his income.

loans.use: to develop his restaurant and buy some chairs, tables, and a refrigerator for his local falafel restaurant.

loans.name: Maro

texts.en:
In the region of Gegharkunik, there is a beautiful and sunny village named Ddmashen, and here lives a very kind and lovely woman Maro with her family. Maro is married and she has two sons and a daughter. Her daughter is married and lives separately; her elder son is also married and works with the peacekeeping troops.  Her smallest son has recently been discharged from the army and doesn’t work. Maro’s husband is in the Russian Federation for work abroad (he has a specialty in building) and time to time he manages to support his family financially. 

Maro graduated from Yerevan Cooperative College, and she has a specialty in accounting. She managed to work for several years, but after getting married, she became fully engaged in farming and agriculture. She has a plot of land and a big farm. Maro mainly cultivates potato and grains. On her farm she has four cows, five bulls, one calf, three sheep, four piglets, and twenty chickens. There is a lot of work on their farm, and Maro’s smallest son helps her very much.

It is Maro’s first loan and she needs 800,000 Armenian Drams to buy a cow, a calf, and animal fodder.

loans.use: to buy a cow, a calf, and animal fodder.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is aged 31. She sells charcoal and has been in the business for the past six years. With the loan, she wants to buy more charcoal for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay for the children's needs. Agnes has been very thankful for the previous loan, which helped her to increase charcoal sales.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Lutfi

texts.en: Lutfi is a 53 year-old father for four sons. He has a mechanic shop that has been in business for the last six years. In his shop, he only changes some of the cars' parts and he now wants to add more cars' parts that were not available in the shop, to expand his business.   He also wants to bring more brake and tire changing tools.

loans.use: to add more car parts and more brake and tire changing tools.

loans.name: Raul Antonio

texts.es: Raul es muy amable y trabajador, vive con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, El trabaja muy duro en su propia parcela donde siembra maiz y frijol; sus productos son de muy buena calidad cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en sacos asi como muestra la fotografia para luego salir a comercializarla a los diferentes mercados que estan cerca de su lugar de residencia. Raul  solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para contar con el dinero necesario e invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como controles de plaga, fertilizantes, abonos, semillas entre otras cosas que necesita para su siembra, él ansía aumentar sus ventas para poder percibir mayores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Raul is very friendly and hard-working. He lives with his wife and their four children. He works very hard on his own parcel of land where he sows corn and beans. His products are very high in quality. When his harvest is ready, he stores it in sacks as well as taking a picture to then go out and sell it to different markets near his place of residence.

Raul is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL in order to have the money necessary to invest in the purchase of agricultural supplies such as pest control products, fertilizer, compost and seeds, among other things he needs for his harvest. He is anxious to increase his sales in order to be able to earn a better income and give his family more economic stability.

loans.use: to buy pest control products, fertilizers, compost, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur learned how to run a farm when he was little boy. Now he is a farmer who runs a farm with 25 years of experience.  His farm currently includes 11 cows and 4 bulls. Artur and his wife are devoted parents who take care of four children. Only the income that comes from agricultural activities is spent on covering the family's basic costs, so it is very difficult for Artur to save money to cover the farm's costs.

Artur is asking for this loan in order to pay for forage and be able to feed the livestock. The loan is very important for him to be able to continue the expansion of his farm. Although Artur's farm is not very big, he has great plans and a desire to make it rich and profitable. Artur waits for your support.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Isaack

texts.en:
Isaack is 27 years old, married, and supports a family of three children between the ages of 4 years and 7 years; his spouse supports him in meeting some of their financial needs. Isaack runs a motorcycle transport business in Kapsabet town in Nandi County.  He has been in this business for the last five years, and this business generates an average profit of 10,000 KES a month.

Isaack has borrowed a loan of 100,000 KES with Kadet Ltd, and he intends to use the whole amount of the loan to purchase a new motorbike to expand his transport service business. With the anticipated profits, he intends to expand his business by starting a tea farming business to diversify his sources of income, and also to pay school fees for his children.

His hope is that he will be able to repay the loan in time as well as expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Angellea

texts.en:
Angellea is 40 years old, married, and a mother of one child. For the last thirteen years, she has earned a living by selling fruits and vegetables from her food kiosk in Malindi. She earns a monthly income of about KES 7,350 from the business.

Angellea was introduced to KADET LTD by our credit officer, and she is applying for her second loan of KES 20,000. She will use the loan to buy additional stock for her kiosk, such as tomatoes, pineapples, oranges, and onions, which she will resell to her customers. She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for her child, and to continue expanding the business. Her goal for the future is to continue growing the business, so that she may improve her family's financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of fruits and vegetables, which she will resell at her kiosk

loans.name: Wycliffe

texts.en:
Wycliffe is a 45 year-old man from Kemeloi Junction in Vihiga county, which is located in the western part of Kenya.  He supports seven people in his family and is a married man with five children who are 22, 20, 14, 5 and 2 years old respectively.

He sells and repairs shoes, a business he has been doing for the last 20 years and generates a monthly income of KES 30,000.   He has applied for his third loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase more shoe products for resale. He will use the anticipated profit to open another shop for shoes.

His dream is to become a supplier and educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes for sale

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en:
Sabah a 30-year-old mother of three children. When her husband goes to work, she starts her home business selling female clothing items. She depends on the word of mouth to be known and keep selling her goods, and now she is starting to have a good number of customers. 

Now Sabah wants to add lingerie and some formal tops to her inventory to sell, and for that she has applied to this youth loan.

loans.use: to start selling lingerie and some formal tops as part of her existing clothing business.

loans.name: Shireen

texts.en:
Shireen is 35 years old from Gaza. She is married and has five children. She has owned a grocery store since 2009.

Shireen has asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy some goods and a refrigerator for her grocery store. She hopes that this loan will help her increase the products displayed, thus increasing the sales and improving her income.

The one who appears in the picture is Shireen's husband, since she preferred not to appear in the picture herself due to cultural manners.

loans.use: to buy some goods and a refrigerator for her grocery store

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru:
Светлана уже не первый раз ощущает на себе пользу своевременной финансовой помощи, которую она получала от КИВА. У нее увеличилось количество денег в товаре, и доход возрос на 1 000 гривен. 
На сумму в 24 000 гривен она надеется пополнить товар и закупить дополнительную порцию сувенирной продукции, а именно, приобрести сопилки (национальный украинский музыкальный инструмент), рубашки, брелки и магниты. Светлана надеется, что бизнес будет и в дальнейшем развиваться и приносить больше прибыли в семью.
texts.en:
This is not the first time Svetlana has experienced the utility of well-timed financial help from KIVA. She has already increased the amount of capital in inventory, and her income has risen by 1000 hryvnia.

With 24,000 hryvnia she hopes to fill out her inventory and expand her stock of souvenirs: in particular sopilky (a traditional Ukrainian musical instrument), shirts, key chains, and magnets. Svetlana hopes that her business will continue to develop and bring more profits to the family.

loans.use: to purchase souvenirs for retail sale

loans.name: Epiphanie

texts.en: This is Epiphanie, aged 31. She is married and has three children; all of them go to school. With the loan, she wants to buy more sodas and beers for resale. With the profits from the business, she will buy a house, one day.

loans.use: To buy more sodas and beers for resale.

loans.name: Josette

texts.en: Josette is 43 years old. She is a mother of one child aged seven. She sells different items in her canteen. With the loan, she would like to buy more andazi (doughnuts) and fresh milk for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: To buy more andazi and fresh milk for sale.

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy is 32 years old, married, and supports a family of three children ages between 4 and 7 years. His spouse works in a dispensary and supports him in meeting some of their financial needs. He operates a Motorcycle transport business and a hotel in Kapsabet town in Nandi County. He has been in this business for the last five years and with this business he gets an average profit of KES 140,000 a month.

Sammy has borrowed a loan of KES 60,000 with KADET LTD. With this loan he intends to use the whole amount to purchase a new motorbike to expand his transport service business. He anticipates getting profits, which he intends to use to support his family and expand his business. He hopes that after  repaying his loan on time he will consequently meet his customers' needs.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike to expand his transport business.

loans.name: Gesca

texts.en:
Gesca is age 24. She is married with two children ages two and seven. Only one goes to school. 

With the loan she would like to buy more carrots, green beans, and tomatoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy a house.

loans.use: To buy more carrots, green beans, and tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Tuku

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Tuku from Liberia.  She resides in Paynesville South, a suburb just outside Monrovia.  The area is one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County with one of the best standards of living in the country.  Good roads, access to clean water, affordable rents, and plentiful transportation options make Paynesville South one of the most popular places to live.
 
Tuku is married with three children, between 18 and 8. Her children are currently attending school and live at home.

She runs a table business selling fish.  She describes herself as a serious businesswoman. She started her business two years ago, using money given to her by her husband.  She typically works at her business from 7am to 4pm, Monday through Saturday, and transports her goods to her business by bus.  She cites small capital as her greatest challenge.  She is proud of her business because it supports her home.

Using the proceeds of this loan, she intends to purchase fish for her business.  In the future, she plans to build her house and educate her children.  She sincerely thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to purchase fish for her business.

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Samar is a 39-year-old, conservative woman. She asked her husband, who helps her in the business, to appear in the photo in her place.

Samar and her husband have four children to support. During the past seven years, Samar built a poultry house and has been selling some of the chickens' eggs and chickens. Now, Samar is applying for a loan, which she will use to build another poultry house and obtain more chickens.

loans.use: to build another poultry house and obtain more chickens

loans.name: Wejdan

texts.en:
Wejdan is an ambitious 39-year-old woman. She is the mother of four daughters and one son. Wejdan made all the decoration pieces at her home. Whenever she has guests coming over they ask her about them. They told her she should do it as a business and order a piece or two.

At first she did it only when people asked her to, but now Wejdan is seeking to make more handmade pieces that will allow her to participate in local bazaars. So, she applied for a loan to buy more straw, glue, and some decorative flowers to make more trays, mirror frames, and other items.

loans.use: to buy more straw, glue, and some decorative flowers to make more trays and mirror frames.

loans.name: Zulfiniso

texts.ru:
Зульфинисо счастливая мать двух прекрасных детей. Она разведена, к сожалению несколько лет тому назад муж развелся с ней оставив ее одну с двумя детьми.  Зульфинисо было очень трудно одной растить и воспитывать своих детей но она старалась делать все чтобы стать для них и отцом и матерью, чтобы дети не чувствовали  отсутствие отца.  Зульфинисо конечно же сама чувствует себя одинокой и брошенной но старается этого не показывать своим детям. Ее дети очень заботливые и помогают своей матери.  Зульфинисо работает в одном из ресторанов своего города. Она повар, и готовить очень вкусные и не обычные блюда. Зульфинисо очень ответственный и хороший работник,ее очень все любят и ценят как профессионального и хорошего повара. Ее работа ей очень нравиться и за три года работы она достигла очень многого.  
На данный момент Зульфинисо  планирует отремонтировать свой дом так как давно не ремонтировала. Ее дом в очень плохом состоянии и нуждается в обновлении. С этой целю Зульфинисо обратилась в организацию Арванд чтобы получить кредит и купить строительные материалы.
texts.en:
Zulfiniso is a happy mother to two wonderful children. She is divorced - unfortunately, several years ago, her husband divorced her and left her alone with two children.  It was very difficult for Zulfiniso to raise her children by herself, but she tried to do everything to become both their father and their mother, so that her children would not feel the absence of a father.  Of course, Zulfiniso herself feels lonely and abandoned, but she tries not to let her children know this.  Her children are very caring and help their mother.  Zulfiniso works in one of the restaurants in her town. She is a cook, and prepares very delicious and exceptional dishes. Zulfiniso is a very responsible and good worker, and she is loved and valued as a good and professional chef. She likes her job very much and she has achieved a lot in three years.  Now, Zulfiniso plans to repair her house, because it has been a long time since it was repaired.
Her home is in very poor condition, and is in need of renovation. With this goal, Zulfiniso has turned to Avrand in order to receive a loan to purchase building materials.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Eduard

texts.ru:
Эдуард живет в Виноградово. Он занимается ремонтом ювелирных изделий. Работает на себя, без помощников вот уже 2.5 года. Эдуард не женат, живет с матерью. Очень любит свою работу. Этим бизнесом занимался отец Эдуарда, но год тому назад он умер. И Эдуард решил продолжить дело отца. В основном Эдуард занимается ремонтом золотых и серебряных изделий.
Эдуарду необходима сумма в 24 000 гривен для того, чтобы сделать ремонт в своем рабочем кабинете, а также приобрести материалы и нужное оборудование, а именно микроскопы, паяльник и т.п. Со временем Эдуард планирует открыть еще одну точку по ремонту ювелирных изделий.
texts.en: Eduard lives in Vinogradovo. He works for himself, doing jewelry repair, as he has for two and a half years. He is not married, and lives with his mother. He loves his work. Eduard's father was in this business, but he passed away a year ago, and Eduard has decided to carry on his work. For the most part Eduard works with gold and silver jewelry. He needs 24,000 hryvnia to remodel his workshop and buy materials and equipment, specifically microscopes, a soldering iron, etc. Eduard plans to eventually open an additional shop.

loans.use: to remodel his workshop and purchase equipment

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en: Mustafa is a 20-year-old single guy who is attending the university to study and get his bachelor degree in Marketing. Mustafa is the youngest brother of three siblings. He is applying for an educational loan to pay for his next semester's fees.

loans.use: to pay for his next semester's fees.

loans.name: Jecinta

texts.en:
Jecinta is 50 years old and has five children. She has a retail shop in Ndunyu Njeru and has applied for her sixth loan from KADET LTD. to enable her buy stock of items such as sugar, rice, flour, and soap, among others.

Having paid her previous loan successfully, Jecinta's anticipated profit will be used to buy more stock for her business. 

She hopes to open a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: To buy stock of items such as sugar, flour, soap, rice, etc.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is 29 years old and single; he does not support anyone. He runs a retail shop in Kapkangani trading centre, in Kapsabet, Kenya. This has been his income-generating business for the past four years. He earns an average monthly income of KES 15,000.
 
He has borrowed a loan of KES 60,000. He intends to use the loan to purchase stock for his retail shop, including a 50 kg bag of sugar, cooking oil, six bundles of maize flour, and a bundle of wheat flour. He anticipates getting profits, which he intends use to expand his business further, by increasing more inventory items to meet his customers' demand.

Felix hopes to improve his living standard and to be able to meet his financial needs. He also hopes to save money to enable him to build himself a house and help his parents to pay school fees for his siblings. In addition, he would like to expand his business to a general goods wholesale shop.

loans.use: To purchase stock for his grocery store

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 51-year-old man, married with three children aged 22, 16, and 16, and they are all school-going. He deals in piggery and poultry. He began his business in 2003. 

His purpose for starting his business was to start his home income to meet his family's needs and pay tuition for his children. His customers are chicken traders. 

His dream is to be able to have a big poultry farm, so that he can win tenders (contracts) to supply hotels in the city. His challenge is lack of enough markets to sell his chicken. His customers testify that he is hard working and has good customer service.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and also restock chicks.

loans.name: Gulandom

texts.ru: Гуландом замужняя женщина, имеет троих детей. Она занимается торговлей овощами и фруктами.  У неё возле дома есть маленькая лавка, где она продает овощи и фрукты.    Этим видом деятельности занимается уже несколько лет. Муж тоже работает. Гуландом очень старательная женщина, ради своих детей она готова работать без выходных, с утра она ездит на рынок, покупает свежие фрукты и овощи, продает до самого вечера. Раньше ей помогала дочь, но она вышла замуж, муж иногда помогает ей после работы.   Не давно её сын заболел и на его лечение и медикаменты требуется определенная сумма денег, поэтому они с мужем решили получить кредит.  А также они хотят немного освежить свой дом.  Поэтому часть кредита хотят потратить на лечение сына, а на оставшуюся сумму купить строительные материалы и отремонтировать квартиру, так как давно не ремонтировали. Гуландом заранее благодарит организацию Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Gulandom is a married woman who has three children. She is a vendor who sells vegetables and fruits. She has a small stall near her home where she sells vegetables and fruits.  She has engaged in this trade for several years now. Her husband also works. Gulandom is a very diligent woman, who is prepared to work seven days a week for her children.  In the morning, she goes to the market, purchases fresh fruits and vegetables, and sells them until evening.  Earlier, her daughter used to help her, but she got married and her husband sometimes helps after work. Recently, her son became ill, and his treatment and medication require a certain amount of money.  Therefore, she and her husband have decided to take out a loan.  They also want to remodel their home a little.  Because of this, they want to spend a portion of the loan on their son's treatment, and use the rest to purchase building materials in order to repair their apartment, because it has been a long time since they have repaired it. Gulandom thanks Avrand in advance for the support.

loans.use: pay for medical treatment for her son and purchase building materials

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.ru:
Людмила торгует женской одеждой. В основной ассортимент ее товара входят костюмы для женщин, платья, юбки и блузки. Этим бизнесом она занимается уже 7 лет. Торговая точка расположена очень выгодно, есть свои постоянные клиенты. 
Сумму в 24 000 гривен она планирует вложить в закупку новых моделей летней сезонной одежды, а именно, сарафанов, блузок и платьев для полных женщин. Дополнительная финансовая помощь поможет Людмиле обновить модный ассортимент. Товар она уже предварительно заказала на оптовой базе, где он ожидает отгрузки, осталось только оплатить его.
texts.en:
Ludmila sells women's clothing. Her products primarily include suits for women, dresses, skirts and blouses. She has been in this business for over seven years. Her retail outlet has a good location and she has her own loyal customers.

She plans to invest 24,000 UAH to purchase new models of seasonal summer clothing, specifically, sundresses, blouses and plus-sized dresses. The additional financial support would help Ludmila upgrade her merchandise to contemporary fashions. She has already pre-ordered the merchandise at the distribution center, where it is ready to be picked up as soon as she provides payment.

loans.use: to purchase summer merchandise

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 45 years old, married, and supports a family of six people. She runs a cereals business in the Kapsaos trading centre in Nandi County, and she is served by KADET LTD. The Kapsabet office and this have been her income generating business for the last five years, and she earns an average monthly income of KES 19,000.
 
She has borrowed a loan of KES 60,000, and she intends to pay college fees for her children with this loan. She anticipates generating profits that she will use to expand her business by increasing more cereals like sorghum, rice, and others to meet her clients' demand.

Hellen hopes to improve her living standards and be financially stable; she also hopes to save money to enable her to pay school fees for her children as well as expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for college fees.

loans.name: Binta

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Binta B. She is married and has three children, aged 20, 17, and 14 years. 

In 2005, Binta B. established her plastic slippers and sandals business. She began her business because she wanted to support her husband in contributing financially to the running of the home. "I'm self-reliant and independent, and I am not a burden to my husband," said Binta.  Her business is located at the city centre, and her customers are both men and women.  She opens her business seven days a week and 11 hours a day. 

She needs a loan of 5,000,000 Sierra Leonean leones (SLL). She will use it to buy more cartons of slippers to add to her current stock.  Binta expects that this loan will help her increased her profit by approximately 500,000 SLL.  In the future, Binta hopes to rent a shop, so that she can transfer her business there and leave her sister at the stall that she presently occupies.  Binta also plans to expand her business and become a supplier to other traders.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy bags of plastic slippers and sandals, which she will resell

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en: Esperance is 69 years old. She owns a salon and has been running the business for the past year. With the loan, she wants to buy more shampoo and hair cutting machines for use in the salon. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more shampoo and hair cutting machines for use in a salon.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a school bursar, but she also raises both poultry and pigs. She is the single mother of a university graduate, whom she has educated with her own, hard work. She began the business to earn additional income, and to be able to pay tuition for her son.

She would like to use this loan to buy chicken feed for her chickens. Her customers are mainly hotels. Her challenge in the business is the high price of feed, while the price she can command for her chickens remains the same.

Her dream is to finish construction of her home, so that she could have enough space to house even the relatives. She is a strong and hard-working woman, who has determined to change her standard of living and that of the people around her.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed

loans.name: Kebbeh

texts.en:
Kebbeh is 28 years old and lives in Compound #3. She is single and has a five-year-old child who lives at home and is in school. She was unfortunately not able to attend school and has been involved in business since two years ago. 

She states, “I manage my business well in order to help myself financially. I like my business because it gives me more money.” 

The problem she faces is that she has a small amount of money to buy more rice and palm oil. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice and palm oil for her business.

Her plans are to build her house and  educate her child.

loans.use: to purchase rice and palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Abias

texts.en: Abais, a teacher by profession, is married to a fellow teacher, both living with one child. Due to inadequate salary, they both decided to start agriculture as a side income, majorly cattle fattening, coffee and tree planting. He is now applying for a loan of Ushs. 1 million to assist him in buying more cattle, with a target of selling them during the Christmas season at a higher price. The cows can also be a form of security in case of emergencies or loans.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Asmita

texts.en:
Asmita is 30 years old. She is married and has one child, aged 12. In 2008, she established her vegetable farming business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy seed and fertilizer for her business.  

In the future, Asmita plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support.   

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Tenneh

texts.en:
Tenneh is 49 years old and lives in Compound #3. She has six children. The children are between the ages of 30 and 15 years. Only three of them are in school and live at home.

For the past fourteen years, Tenneh has been running a market table, where she sells hardware like door locks, door catches, hinges, and nails. One problem she faces is the complaining of customers that prices of goods are getting higher every day. She says she makes a lot of profit. She started this business with help from her mother, and learned this way of selling from her.

Tenneh is requesting a loan to buy more inventory for her business, including door locks, door catches, hinges, and nails. Her plans are to build a house and to buy a car. She wants to thank the Kiva lenders in advance, for their help.

loans.use: to buy more inventory to sell at her market table, including door locks, door catches, hinges, and nails.

loans.name: Janjay

texts.en:
Please meet 38-year-old Janjay from Buchanan. Buchanan is the capital City of Grand Bassa County and is located by the sea. It is well-known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia.

She did not go to school and is married. She describes herself as a hardworking woman. She has three children between the ages of 8 and 19. They are in school and live at home.

Janjay has a table business which sells rice, pepper, oil and onion, etc. She has been in business for three years and works 10 hours each day at the business. With this loan, she will buy rice, pepper, oil and onion to resell. One of the greatest challenges that she faces is less income. She transports her goods by taxi. She started her business with money from her husband. She is proud of her business because of the profit she makes. Her future plan is to build a house. She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to buy rice, pepper, oil, and onion to resell.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
This is Rita from Liberia. She resides in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County. The county is located by the sea and is known for their beaches and fish. In addition, many logging companies are also located in the city. People in Buchanan are known in the country for their love of fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. 

She is 24. She is married and has a 6-year-old child. Her child is currently in school. 
 
Rita owns a table business, selling hair grease, toothpaste, polish, etc. She will use the loan proceeds to purchase more hair grease, toothpaste, polish, etc., for her business.  

On average, she works 10 hours at her business from Monday to Saturday. She started her business with small money from her husband. She transports her merchandise by shared taxi. She cites the rainy season as her biggest challenge. Her favorite part of her business is controlling her own money. In the future, she would like to build a modern shop.  

She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more hair grease, toothpaste, polish, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
This is Rebecca from Liberia. She resides in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County. The county is located by the sea and is known for their beaches and fish. In addition, many logging companies are also located in the city. People in Buchanan are known in the country for their love of fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. 

She is 34 and married with three children. Her children are between the ages of 10 and 3. They are currently living at home and in school.  

Rebecca owns her own table business, selling fresh fish. She will use the loan proceeds to purchase more fish for her business.  
On average, she works 10 hours at her business from Monday to Saturday. She started her business with small money from her husband. She transports her merchandise by shared taxi. She cites the rainy season as her biggest challenge. Her favorite part of her business is controlling her own money. In the future, she would like to build a modern shop.  

She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Babita

texts.en:
Babita is 29 years old. She is married and has one child, aged 12. In 2005, she established her grocery store business. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW, and used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, Babita plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family.  She thanks you for your support.  

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called pasals, are an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buys grocery goods for her business.

loans.name: Enock

texts.en:
Enock is a married man who is 33 years old and has no one to support. He owns a retail shop in Esageri and has been in operation for over eight years, earning an income of KES 25,000.

He is servicing his eighth loan of KES 55,000 from KADET LTD and intends to use this amount to purchase more stock of mali mali (household) products for resale.  The anticipated amounts will be used to repay the loan.

His dream is to be successful in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy another dryer and relaxers for the salon.

loans.name: Siah

texts.en:
Please meet 32-year-old Siah, from Buchanan.  Buchanan is the capital city of Grand Bassa County and is located by the sea.  It is well-known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are also based in the city.  Residents of the city love eating fufu, which is made from a cassava-based dough and typically eaten with soup or sauce.  Most people in the city speak Bassa, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia.
 
Siah describes herself as a hardworking woman.  She is married and has three children, who are between the ages of 11 and 9.  Although Siah, herself, did not go to school, her three children are all in school.  They live at home with her.

Siah has a table business, where she sells toothpaste, soap, candles, and the like.  She has been in business for three years, and she works 10 hours each day at her business.  With this loan, she will buy more things to sell at her table, including toothpaste, soap, and candles.  One of the greatest challenges that she faces is low income.  She transports her goods by taxi.  She started her business with money she got from her husband.  She is proud of her business, because of the profit she makes. Her future plan is to build a house.  She thanks you, in advance, for your support!

loans.use: to buy more things to sell at her table, including toothpaste, soap, and candles

loans.name: Janjay

texts.en:
Please meet 30-year-old Janjay from Buchanan. Buchanan is the capital city of Grand Bassa County and is located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Janjay did not go to school and is married. She describes herself as a hardworking woman. Her spouse works as a security man. They have four children aged between 11 and 3; they are in school and live at home.
 
Janjay has a shop which sells rice, sugar, water, etc. She has been in business for 10 years and works from Monday to Saturday, spending nine hours there each day. With this loan, she will buy rice, sugar, water, etc. One of the greatest challenges that she faces is to increase her sales. She transports her goods by taxi. She started her business with money from her husband. She is proud of her business because of the profit she makes. 

Her future plan is to build a house. She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, water, etc.

loans.name: Felipa Anastasia

texts.es:
La señora Anastasia  posee un negocio de venta refrescos naturales desde hace 31 años, lo elabora en su casa de habitación a la 7 am y posteriormente lo comercializa de forma ambulante en las calles de la ciudad de León finalizando a la 1 pm. 

Ella realiza esta tipo de trabajo para la mantención de su hogar,  es madre de cuatro hijos de los cuales ninguno está a su cargo.

El crédito que está solicitando a Ceprodel será utilizado para compra de Zinc, para ser utilizado en la  reparación  del techo de su vivienda ya   que estamos en época de invierno, y así  mejorar su  condición de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Anastasia has had a business selling natural sodas for 31 years. She makes them in her house at 7:00 a.m. and following that, she sells them on foot in the streets of the city of León until 1:00 p.m. She does this type of work in order to support  her household. 

She is the mother of four children whom she is not in charge of. The loan she is requesting from Ceprodel will be used to buy zinc to be used in the repair of the roof of her home since it is winter, and that will improve her and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy zinc

loans.name: Srey Touch

texts.en:
Srey Touch (in the photo), age 23, is a garment worker. Her husband, Sam, age 22, is a construction worker. They have been married since 2012 and have no children yet. They live in suburb of Phnom Penh about 15 kilometers. 
Srey Touch is asking for a loan to buy a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for commuting to work.

loans.name: Mariyam

texts.en: Mariyam is 48 years old and married. She is running a business selling milk with the support of her husband. She has been doing this for many years. She has one buffalo in milk. She looks after the buffalo and performs the task of selling milk in her community. She also deals with the sale and purchase of animals to generate an extra amount of profit to contribute to the family income. She needs to earn more revenue to meet her everyday expenditures including food, clothing and education.  For this reason, she requested a loan of Rs 30,000 to buy another buffalo in milk to serve more customers. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Please meet 31-year-old Theresa, from Buchanan, the capital of Grand Bassa County, located by the sea. Buchanan is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are based in the city. Residents love eating fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city speak Bassa, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia.

Theresa is married with four children aged 4 to 12. The children are in school. Theresa describes herself as a hardworking woman. Her spouse works as a security guard. 

Theresa did not attend school. She has a shop that sells soap. She has been in this business for six years, working nine hours per day from Monday to Saturday. She started her business with money from her husband and she is proud of it because the profit she makes. 

One of Theresa’s greatest challenges is to increase her sales. She transports her goods by taxi. With this loan, she will buy soap for her business. 

Her future plan is to build a house. She thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to buy soap for her business.

loans.name: Amani

texts.en: Amani, 36 years old, is from Nablus. She is married and has four children, three of whom go to primary school. She has owned a clothing shop since 2003 and has two employees in the shop. She asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy sewing machines to be able to mend clothes for her clothing shop. She hopes that this loan will help her to increase sales and thus improve her income to help her approach her dream of owning a big shop.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines

loans.name: Luz Adilia

texts.es:
Luz Adilia es una señora de 38 años, madre de dos hijos que están en edad escolar. Habita en el municipio de El Sauce donde fue nacida y criada.
Desde hace 10 años inició su negocio con un pequeño capital que le financiaron con el objetivo de tener su propio negocio el cual consiste en una pulpería donde ofrece abarrotería en general, que generara ingresos para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar.
Poco a poco ha ido creciendo y surtiendo el inventario de productos que ayudan a atraer a sus clientes.
Esta señora es muy trabajadora ya que desde las cinco de la mañana inicia su labor alistando a su hijo para el colegio y luego atender el negocio junto con los quehaceres del hogar.
Todo esto lo hace con sacrificio para darle lo mejor a sus hijos en educación y dejarles como herencia para el futuro una buena casa para que no les falte un techo donde vivir.
Con el fin de seguir surtiendo el negocio de productos que actualmente no tiene para atraer la demanda de sus clientes está necesitando de un crédito para comprar jabón, arroz, azúcar, maíz y aceite.
Espera y confía en Dios que los inversionistas de Kiva a través de Ceprodel le otorgarán este préstamo para seguir luchando y salir adelante
texts.en:
Luz Adilia is a 38-year-old woman and mother of two children who are school-aged.  She lives in the town of El Sauce, where she was born and raised.  Ten years ago she began her business with the little capital that she was loaned, and with the goal to have her own grocery store business where she offered general goods that would generate income to help her husband with the household expenses.  Little by little it has grown and she has stocked it with an inventory of products that help attract her customers.

This Señora is very hard-working because at five in the morning she begins her work; preparing her son for school and later tending to the business as well as all the household chores.  All of this is done with sacrifice in order to give her children the best education and to leave them, as an inheritance in the future, a good house so that they do not lack a roof to live under.  

With the goal of continuing to stock the business with products that she doesn't currently have to attract her customers, she is asking for a loan to buy soap, rice, sugar, corn, and oil.  She hopes and has faith in God that the Kiva lenders, through Ceprodel, will grant her this loan to continue working and to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy soap, rice, sugar, corn, and oil.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en: Salma is a 40-year-old married woman who has been selling milk for the past five years. She has one cow in milk. She sells the milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. She has five children, all of whom are in school. She is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life with a good education, food and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life.  It’s her fourth year with Kashf Foundation and she is happily running her business with their support. Now, she requested a loan of Rs 40,000 to purchase another cow in milk. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase another cow

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Please meet 35-year-old Theresa from Buchanan. Buchanan is the capital city of Grand Bassa County and is located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Theresa stopped her education at 5th grade and is married. She describes herself as a hard-working woman. Her spouse works as a security man.  They have five children between the ages of 12 and 19; only two are in school and live at home. 

Theresa has a shop which sells pepper, garlic, onion, salt, vita (soda), etc.  She has been in business for 15 years and works from Monday to Saturday, ten hours per day.  With this loan, she will buy pepper, garlic, onion, salt, vita etc. One of the greatest challenges that she faces is to increase her sales.  She transports her goods by taxi.  She started her business with money from her husband.  She is proud of her business because of the profit she makes. Her future plan is to build a house. She thanks you in advanced for your support!

loans.use: she will buy pepper, garlic, onion, salt, vita etc.

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en:
Please meet 44-year-old Oretha from Buchanan. Buchanan is the capital city of Grand Bassa County and is located by the sea.  It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city.  Residents of the city love eating fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city speak Bassa, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

She did not go to school and is married. She describes herself as a hardworking woman. She has three children between the ages of 6 and 20. They are in school and live at home. 

Oretha has a table business which sells rice, oil, salt, etc.  She has been in business for three years and works ten hours per day in her business. With this loan, she will buy rice, oil, salt, etc. One of the greatest challenges that she faces is limited income. She transports her goods by taxi. She started her business with money from her husband. She is proud of her business because of the profit she makes. Her future plan is to build a house. She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, salt, etc.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en:
Mexico's Delfina specializes in hand-loomed Zapotec rugs. She would like to invest in a bulk purchase of wool yarn for her rugs.

Delfina has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is her story:

Delfina grew up with parents who were Zapotec rug artisans. 

"When I was 18, I created my first piece. This is the art my parents dedicated their lives to, and it's what I know best," she says. "Through your support I'm able to preserve a family tradition. I appreciate your microcredit. It helps [us] to keep our dreams alive and continue doing what we love. Thank you."

Use the link below to view Delfina's Zapotec wool rugs on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/7876

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of wool yarn for her rugs

loans.name: Mujeres De Chuanoj Group

texts.en:
The Trust Bank, “Mujeres de Chuanoj” is located in Chuanoj, a rural area in Totonicapan, Guatemala. It was formed three years ago and has provided valuable opportunities for the ten women to access loans and education through Friendship Bridge. The women were able to either start, maintain or grow various businesses such as animal husbandry, retail sales (snacks, typical clothing) or weaving. In this way, they generate income to support their families.

Two of the members of the Trust Bank are new and one of them is 41-year-old Eufemia. She is widowed with four children. Before her husband died four years ago, Eufemia depended on him to provide financial support for the family. After his death, she needed to find a way to support herself and her children, two of whom are in school. She began to raise chickens and soon realized that her business could prosper with more investment. Eufemia learned of Friendship Bridge, attended meetings and requested her first loan! Currently, she has one dozen chickens that she sells in the local market. With her loan, Eufemia intends to purchase three dozen additional chickens as well as feed to fatten them. This industrious woman also is involved with textile design which is an additional way for her to generate income.

Eufemia is very confident that her business will prosper. She tells us that she feels blessed and happy with the opportunity to be a part of “Mujeres de Chuanoj”. In her own words, "It is not easy being a mother and father at the same time. As mothers, our children are our first priorities and we need to do everything possible to support and provide for them. This loan will greatly benefit my business and my family.”

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Douglas Armando

texts.es: Douglas se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años siembra frijol y maíz, comercializa sus cosechas en los mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, es un hombre responsable, honesto y trabajador vive con su esposa y sus tres  hijos. Douglas está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar insumos para su cosecha como: fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, herbicidas, etc. ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y asi tener mejores cosechas para darle a su familia  una mejor estabilidad económica
texts.en:
Douglas has made a living through agriculture for several years.  He grows beans and corn, and sells his harvests in the markets that are near his home.  With the sales of his harvests he manages to cover the household expenses.  He is a very responsible, honest, and hard-working man who lives with his wife and three children.  

Douglas is asking for a loan so that he can buy supplies for his harvest like fertilizer, compost, seeds, herbicide, etc., because with what he earns he is not able to cover these expenses.  And this way he will have better harvests to give his family better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, compost, seeds, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Neomi

texts.en:
Please meet 35-year-old Neomi from Buchanan. Buchanan is the capital city of Grand Bassa County and is located by the sea.  It is well-known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city speak Bassa, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 
 
She did not go to school and is married.  She describes herself as a hard-working woman. Her spouse works as a security man. They have four children between the ages of 3 and 15; they are in school and live at home.
 
Neomi has a shop which sells rice, by cup, in the local market.  She has been in business for six years and works from Monday to Saturday, working ten hours per day. With this loan, she will buy rice, by bag, for her business.  One of the greatest challenges that she faces is to increase her sales.  She transports her goods by taxi. She started her business with money from her husband.  She is proud of her business because of the profit she makes. Her future plan is to build a house. She thanks you in advanced for your support!

loans.use: to buy rice, by bag, for her business.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Please meet 42-year-old Marie from Buchanan. Buchanan is the capital city of Grand Bassa County and is located by the sea. It is well-known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city speak Bassa, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

She did not go to school and is married. She describes herself as a hardworking woman. Her spouse works as a security man. They have four children between the ages of 13 and 26; only two are in school and live at home. 

Marie has a shop which sells rubber dishes (plates, spoon, cups, etc.) and lappa (traditional clothes). She has been in business for 20 years and works from Monday to Saturday, 10 hours per day.  With this loan, she will buy rubber dishes and lappa for her business.  One of the greatest challenges that she faces is to increase her sales. She transports her goods by taxi. She started her business with money from her husband.  She is proud of her business because the profit she makes. Her future plan is to build a house. She thanks you in advanced for your support!

loans.use: she will buy rubber dishes and lappa for her business.

loans.name: Israel

texts.en:
Israel, working alongside his family, weaves Zapotec rugs using traditional looms and natural dyes. He would like to purchase wool yarn and to be able to add more weavers to his workshop.

Israel has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

Israel and his family have been weaving Zapotec rugs for many generations. 

"We purchase wool from a nearby farmer and we dye it with natural dyes," he says. "With your kind help, our family will be able to get ahead, and we will also be able to help support other families in our village. Thank you for believing in us!"

Use the link below to view Israel's Zapotec wool rugs on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/339

loans.use: to purchase wool yarn and to hire more weavers for his workshop

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor carves traditional African masks by hand. He would like to invest in a purchase of the materials he uses, including wood, paints, metal and polish.

Victor has been selling through NOVICA since 2003. This is his story:

Victor was unable to study beyond elementary school due to financial difficulties. 

"I joined my brother-in-law, who was a master carver specializing in traditional African objects," says Victor. "Since 1999, I've worked independently with ten experienced carvers. We use a hardwood known as sese for carving our masks. We use sandpaper and polish to achieve a smooth finish of good quality. I use paint, metal plates and sometimes clay to decorate and preserve our works."

"I thank each of you for this microcredit, for you have been a blessing to my life and that of my family," he says. "Please accept my gratitude."

Use the link below to view Victor's hand-carved wood masks on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/3571

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for his hand-carved masks

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Abdul is a carver from Ghana. He would like to invest in materials for his hand-carved African masks and purchase tools for his workshop.

Abdul has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is his story:

"I always knew I wanted to paint, but wasn't sure I could make a living out of it, so I looked into other fields too. I observed a master carver at his workshop for a period of time, then I picked up a log of wood and started carving out a mask as I had observed him doing. This surprised him and he was willing to help me perfect the skill. I developed a love for this new art, and that's how I eventually became a master carver myself.

"I am very grateful to those of you who help to fund my loan. Without you, I would never have reached where I am now. May God bless you all."

Use this link to view Abdul's hand-carved wood masks on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/7253

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for his carvings and tools for his workshop

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
This is Julieta, 50, a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Alfredo, a construction worker, and is a mother to their children. Together with husband, she manages their household while operating the business. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Julieta maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and this margin constitutes the profits that dealers invest on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Julieta dreams of being successful in her business and hopes that her youngest child will finish his studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en: Najma is a 35-year-old married woman who works from home as a tailor. She has been in this line of work for two years now and is proud to be contributing to her household income.  Her husband’s monthly income is not enough to fulfill the needs of the family members and that compelled Najma to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. Her hard work helped her establish a good clientele. To meet the orders of her customers on time, she requested a loan of Rs 30,000 to buy stocks of threads in different colors plus packs of zippers, buttons and laces. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy threads, zippers, buttons and laces.

loans.name: Mujeres De Chucaja Group

texts.en:
The small village of Chucaja is found in the department of El Quiché in western Guatemala. The population of this area is mainly involved in agriculture and animal husbandry. Some work in handicrafts and textiles.

The Trust Bank, “Mujeres de Chucaja,” is located in this village. The average age of these women is 41 and they each have about three children. The women have had less than two years of education. They speak the local language of K’iche and most do not speak Spanish at all.

Lucia is the current President of the Trust Bank. She is a 29-year-old single mother of a beautiful one-year-old daughter. She is determined to see a bright future for her daughter and this motivates her to strive forward. Friendship Bridge has been of great value in Lucia’s life as it has allowed her to grow her business. She owns a little store where she sells items for daily consumption. With the new loan that Lucia is requesting, she will purchase more items for her store such as rice, noodles, sugar, salt, oil, soft drinks, and juices. She is sensitive to the wishes of her customers and wants to have plenty of products on the shelves. Lucia also raises chickens and pigs. With her loan, she will be able to purchase more chickens, fatten them up, and sell them in the local market.

Lucia is an effective and enthusiastic leader. The women in the group are lively and dynamic during their monthly meetings. They are happy to participate and eager to receive trainings on topics like effective business administration practices, women’s health, and self-esteem. All the women of “Mujeres de Chucaja” express their appreciation to each KIVA investor for their generosity and their confidence. They are committed to making prompt payments on their loans and look forward to a brighter future for themselves, their families and their community.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her store.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
This is Gregoria, 53, ra esident of Batasan, Quezon City. She is married to Rogelio and is a mother to their children. Along with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Gregoria maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and the margins are the profits that dealers are investing in as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business.

Gregoria hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams that they will have a happy and peaceful family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Cinderella

texts.en:
This is Cinderella. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more products and grocery items for her variety store. The loan also helped in their everyday expenses. Aside from her variety store, she also sells designed balloons and she has an electronic loading station. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Cinderella would like to apply for another loan in the amount of 51,000 PHP to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Cinderella dreams that her businesses will continue to grow and expand. She hopes that her family will always be in good condition. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of their work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Mary P.

texts.en:
Forty-four year old Mary operates a table selling chicken, pig's feet, pig's tail etc in the Paynesville South area of Liberia.  It is a suburb of the capital city of Monrovia and one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County. The area boasts one of the best standards of living in the county with affordable rents, good roads, access to water and lots of transportation options. 

She is married and has five children between 29 and 15 years old. Only two are currently attending school and four of them live at home.  She does not read or write but she is good at managing her business.  She describes herself as a good businesswoman.

Mary has had a table business for the past 10 years now.  She works 12 hours, six days a week at her business.  Her greatest challenge is her low income. She intends to use the loan to buy more chicken, pig's feet, pig's tail etc. She started her business with help from her husband who sells charcoal.  She likes her business because it helps her to buy some items for the home.  In the future, she wants to own a house.  

She wants to thank the lenders for supporting BRAC Liberia and its borrowers.

loans.use: to buy more chicken, pig's feet, pig's tail etc.

loans.name: Rubidia

texts.es: Rubidia de 53 años de edad vive con su hija en casa propia, ella tiene un pequeño negocio donde vende detergentes, jabones, shampoo, papel higiénico, etc. desde hace 10 años, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada, tiene mucha clientela pues vende a buen precio sus productos y es muy amable, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, doña rubidia esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar mas mercadería por mayor  y poder surtir mas su negocio para obtener mejores ganancias y tener una mejor estabilidad económica con su hija.
texts.en:
53-year-old Rubidia lives with her daughter in her own house.  She has a small business where she has sold detergents, soap, shampoo, toilet paper, etc. for ten years.  Her business is located in her home, which is in a busy area.  She has many customers because she sells her products at a good price and is very kind.  With the earnings that she gets she is able to cover some of the household expenses.  

Doña Rubidia is asking for a loan so that she can buy more wholesale merchandise and be able to stock up her business in order to get better profits and to have better financial stability for her daughter.

loans.use: to buy wholesale detergent, soap, shampoo, toilet paper, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soft drinks, sugar, milk, flour, fruits, noodles, and other ingredients needed to cook and sell

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo is a diligent farmer. Despite being old, he still wants to succeed and lift up his family's living condition. As he said, "It’s not too late to pursue it."  While he is living, he will do his best and give his family a better way of living.
