Rodrigo grows rice.  His wish for more development motivates him to borrow a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and herbicides, which are very much needed in his rice field. He hopes to gain increased income to further support the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita owns a half hectare rice field. She has been engaged in the farming business since 1972. She is now 58 years old, married and has six children, all of whom are already married. In addition to farming rice, she maintains a hog raising business.  

Margarita aspires to obtain greater income so she can maintain her rice farming and hog raising business. In order to keep her farmland productive, she is seeking additional capital of PHP 15,000. This amount will be use to buy fertilizers and insecticides, which she believes will improve the growth of her crops. She hopes to earn better profits and to have a good harvest.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Artemio

texts.en:
Artemio is a farmer who lives in Alcala, Cagayan. He is 59 years old and married. He usually earns around PHP 10,000 each harvest season, which is twice a year. He budgets his income as rolling capital in his business and for their household needs.  

Artemio would like to further develop the growth of his crops but is lacking financially. This is why he is borrowing a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides for his farm. He would like to keep improving his farming business and to save funds for future expenses of his family. He also wishes to become a successful corn grower someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Joventino

texts.en:
Joventino runs a sari-sari (variety store) business selling various goods and items to the people in his place, in Trinidad, Bohol. He is a married man and has ten children. Joventino has been in the business for more than seven years now.

Joventino is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell, such as canned goods, candies, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, and feeds. With this, he will be able to improve the variety of his stock, thus attracting more buyers to his store.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell such as canned goods, candies, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, and feeds

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a farmer from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. Lilia is a married woman and has been in the farming business for more than a year now. This is the source of her income.

Lilia is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve her farm as well as her harvest. 

In the future, Lilia hopes to make her business a success and a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 51-year-old man who lives with his wife Magdalena and six children. Julius is a farmer who harvests rice. In order to generate more regular income to supplement his quarterly rice harvests and meet his family needs, Julius plants vegetables such as mustard greens and string beans. He learned farming skills from his parents and every day he goes out on foot to the farm which is three kilometers away. The produce from his harvest he sells in the local traditional market.

Julius plans to buy a calf and seeds to plant more vegetables. He is therefore asking for an individual loan from TLM to the amount of IDR 4,500,000. He hopes that his investment will run well so he will be able to provide for his family and also repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy a calf and seeds to plant more vegetables

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca works hard to support her family. Rebecca is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

Rebecca requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additonal ingredients for her business.

Rebecca has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Rebecca would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additonal ingredients for her business

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es: Juan, es un señor preocupado por la seguridad   de los demás, por eso por vocación escogió  trabajar como agente de seguridad personal,  la cual la ejerce en un centro de salud de la localidad donde habita, con 20 años de ejercer dicha profesión, es casado con tres  hijo menores a su cargo, a los  que les brinda todo el apoyo necesario para su desarrollo, actualmente está presentando una necesidad de Mejorar  su vivienda, por lo que se decidió visitar a ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento para la compra de materiales de construcción como; perlines, laminas de zinc, puertas, ventanas, transporte y mano de  obra para realizar  la construcción de su vivienda que tanto necesita y de esa manera mejorar las condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Juan is a man who is worried about the safety of others; this is why he chose to work as a personal security agent.  He does this at a health center in the town where he lives.  He has spent 20 years in this profession, and is married with three children under his care to whom he offers all the help that they need to grow.  

He is currently faced with the need to improve his home, which is why he decided to visit Ceprodel to ask for a loan to buy construction materials like rafters, sheets of zinc, doors, and windows; and to pay for transportation and labor in order to carry out the construction on his house that it so much needs, and thus improve their living conditions and standard of living.

loans.use: to buy rafters, sheets of zinc, doors, and windows; and to pay for transportation and labor.

loans.name: Maria Tirisa

texts.en: Maria Tirisa is a farmer from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of five children. Maria Tirisa is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm as well as educational supplies for her children. With this, she will be able to improve her farm and her harvest. In the future, Maria Tirisa hopes to improve her farm and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm as well as educational supplies for her children.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en: Margie is a diligent mother of three children. She always prioritizes her children's needs, especially their education. Margie and her husband grow rice in their fields. They have been managing their farm since they got married. Margie and her husband wish to see their children as professionals someday; thus, they are really doing their best to earn a higher income in order to save for the school fees. Margie admits that she is having difficulty in providing their farm needs since their children's needs in school are getting bigger. With that, she decided to borrow a loan amounting 35,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and herbicides for the farm's rice. She hopes that Kiva lenders will approve her requested loan for it will really help in their rice farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides for the farm's rice.

loans.name: Moises

texts.en: Moises earns a living through his sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in his place. Moises is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, and soap and toiletries. With this, he will be able to improve his store thus attracting more buyers in his store. In the future, Moises hopes of making his business a success and a stable source of his income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, and soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a farmer who is raising his family in a rural community. He is 41 years old and has five school-aged children. Despite the hardship of living, he aims to continue sending his children to school so that they will earn a degree and be employed someday. 

To reach this goal, he planned to expand his vegetable plantation to increase his production. Due to inadequate capital, he is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and insecticides needed to sustain his crop production. Through patience and hard work, he hopes that he will have increased production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides needed to sustain his crop production

loans.name: Jeremias

texts.en:
Jeremias is a hardworking father whose aim is to uplift his family's living situation and provide for the basic needs of his family.  He is engaged in the rice farming business and this has been the family's main source of income. The business provides for the immediate needs of his family, especially the educational needs of their children. 

Jeremias is now requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP to pay for the labor cost of the land preparation, pulling of seeds, and transplanting in the rice field.  He knows that the loan will be of big help, not only for the growth of his business, but also for his family.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en: Nelia has been engaged in the hog raising business for more than a year now. She lives with her family in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. Nelia is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and feeds. With this, she will be able to improve her business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and feeds.

loans.name: Neda

texts.en:
This is Neda, 26, resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. She has two children, and she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Neda operates a rug making business. She mainly offers rugs - from those round, palm sized ones to the much larger doormats - and other crafts that most rug makers come up with every day. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, rugs are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 13,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials for her business. 

Neda hopes to expand her business and have more. She dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week in a place where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Oranci

texts.en:
Oranci is a 32-year-old woman who is married to Imanuel. Oranci's husband is a labourer, and together they have four school-aged children: Elsi, Tonce, Desy, and Ambo.

Oranci started a kiosk business in 2011 with her own capital. She sells a number of things at the local market, including soaps, detergents, instant noodles, snacks, soft drinks, and vegetables. However, she is now having difficulty taking care of her four children and thinks it best to move her business close to her house.

Oranci wants to increase the stock at her kiosk and to repair her house, but needs additional capital to do so. She is therefore asking for an individual loan from Tanaoba Lais Manekat (TLM) for 4,750,000 IDR. She hopes that the business will be a success so that she can repay her loan in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to increase the stock at her kiosk and repair her house.

loans.name: Ana Zulema

texts.es:
Ana Zulema es originaria de la comunidad Los Zarzales del municipio de El Jicaral, es un caserío conformado por unas treinta casas ubicado a la orilla de la carretera donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura por la bondad de la tierra.
Ana Zulema se crió en una finca humilde donde desde muy pequeña aprendió la labor de la agricultura pero también estudió la carrera de educación porque le gusta enseñar a leer y escribir a los niños. Desde entonces hace más de veinte años imparte clases a los niños de su comunidad en la pequeña escuela de dicho lugar.
Cabe mencionar que los fines de semana ella, su esposo y sus cuatro hijos se dedican a la labor de la agricultura en su finca la cual fue herencia de sus padres donde cosechan maíz y frijoles.
A través de unas compañera de trabajo se dio cuenta que hay unos inversionistas de kiva que financian créditos a las personas de escasos recursos a través de Ceprodel y por primera vez se presentó a dicha oficina con el objetivo de solicitar un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas ya que entró la temporada de invierno cuando es que se aprovecha para la cosecha y quieren cosechar maíz y frijoles.
Espera que su solicitud sea aprobada para mejorar su condición económica ya que con la comercialización de estos granos se ayudan económicamente.
texts.en:
Ana Zulema is originally from the community of Los Zarzales in the municipality of El Jicaral. It is a community of some 30 houses located on the edge of a road where the majority of the inhabitants make their living in agriculture, through the goodness of the earth. 

Ana Zulema was raised on a modest farm where she learned agricultural work from an early age. However, she also studied to be a teacher because she likes teaching reading and writing to children. Since that time more than 20 years ago, she has been offering classes to children in her community's small schoolhouse. On weekends she, her husband, and their four children engage in agricultural labor on their farm, which she inherited from her parents and where they harvest corn and beans. 

Through some of her friends at work, she learned about the Kiva lenders who finance loans for poor people through CEPRODEL. She then came to the office to ask for a loan to buy agricultural supplies because the winter harvest season was coming and they wanted to harvest corn and beans. She hopes that her request will be approved so she can improve her economic situation because bringing these foods to market helps her economically.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is 37 years old and is a responsible working lady. She is successfully running a business of clothing sales with the support of her husband. Her husband buys gents' cloths from the market, which Razia then sells to the people of her community at higher rates. Her dealings with customers are very good and are done in a respectful manner that increases her customers’ lists day by day.

Razia wants to expand her business to meet with the increasing demands of her customers. She requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to buy a wide variety of clothes for ladies and gents in different colors and fabrics. She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move in a positive direction as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of clothes for ladies and gents in both different colors and fabrics.

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina and Phil are working for The Oyster Ltd. Martina and Phil are looking after the program and overall management of The Oyster Ltd.  A community outreach to the people is perfectly taken care of by Dickson. On the ground, people like Betty are working as “Basic Energy Entrepreneurs” on the promotion of the products to the local communities.They facilitate the saving and collection of money, do refresher trainings if a user has questions on the products, as well as make small repairs in case of simple issues, or facilitate the contact between the community customer and our office if need be. In return, they gain not only respect from their communities, but also a commission on top of their subsistence farming and small business activities. 

"We can keep the end-customer prices low through the bigger quantity of solar lamps imported at one time, which is necessary for many families to be able to afford the lights. It will also ease our distribution to more remote entrepreneurs who normally keep stocks longer, as they have to wait for their customers to save up the money.

We have been field-testing a broad range of micro-solar devices from many manufacturers and countries, and we found the acceptance and quality-price ratio of the Barefoot Power products are comparatively good. People like the systems, and since we started the test marketing about two years ago, we have not had many issues with these products. 

The manufacturer warranty on all products is very important to us, as we want people to not spend the little money they have on unsustainable things. Also, Barefoot Power brings in their staff to Malawi from time to time to support our team and entrepreneurs with repair and sales trainings.

Several years of baseline research in Malawian villages and towns has given us a good feeling for the impacts of energy poverty and on how much time and money people spend on sourcing energy for lighting and phone charging. The sources they use, paraffin and one-way batteries as well as car batteries stations for phone charging, are burdening their already low household incomes a lot in the long-run, apart from carrying health risks and being environmentally unsound. Micro-solar products help people to resolve these issues at once, and are making them long-term independent and improve their lives.
	
When people buy our micro-solar systems, we also give them a sheet on which they can calculate their monthly savings from using it, and we get encouraging feedback from many. We even find that after a year has passed from a village demonstration, people still find their way to our outlet because they have seen their neighbours using one of our solar kits and have saved up all the time to finally have one, too. 

School children mention that they are not coughing anymore and have better results in school because they have more time to study and spend less time running to charge devices. Business people can open their shops longer and raise their income. And quite a few of our community-based entrepreneurs have become well respected agents of change in their community. The additional income helps them to improve their livelihoods decisively and help to cover those things which are normally hard to cater to, like paying school fees for the children to attend secondary school, maintaining the house in the rainy season and buying fertilizer for the maize field.

We are striving to increase the number of energy entrepreneurs by at least 30 this year, and have greater awareness across more communities in Malawi that high-quality micro-solar products are available and where people can find them. In this way, our entrepreneurs can also increase their turnovers and income while bringing more healthy lights into more families.

We are also currently trying to establish a revolving fund for a lease-&-buy program, which would allow very low-income households to first rent the lamps from their local entrepreneur and recharge them with him/her, and later purchase the system. This way, people can benefit from the lights earlier and use the money otherwise spent on paraffin or batteries to repay the cost of the system, instead of having to save that up from an extra budget. 

The entrepreneurs would also be rewarded by this through earning additional recurring service fee revenue and could involve other people in his or her business, as well as reach out to more customers, even those who could normally not dream of having a nice lamp."

loans.use: to buy and sell Barefoot Power's solar lighting products.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el cliente se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 6 años y eso le ha dado la capacidad y el conocimiento necesario para asistir sus cultivos, su principal siembra es el maíz y el frijol, comercializa sus cultivos en agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos que su familia tiene, vive en casa propia con su padre quien también le ayuda a trabajar en la agricultura, cuando pasa la temporada agrícola el cliente se dedica a trabajar de jornalero en una finca cerca de su casa, el cliente esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar insumos agrícolas que le ayuden en la siembra de sus cultivos como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, etc. y mejorar el terreno donde desea hacer su siembra que es el que muestra la fotografía  y asi poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando en los gastos de su casa sin ninguna limitación.
texts.en: This client has made his living in agriculture for the last six years.  This has given him the necessary capacity and knowledge to tend to his crops.  His main crops are corn and beans.  He sells his crops to agencies near his home that buy and sell basic grains.  With the money he earns from his sales, he helps with his family's expenses.  He lives in his own home with his father, who also helps with the farming.  When the agricultural season has passed, the client works as a day laborer at a near-by ranch.  The client is requesting a loan to be able to purchase agricultural supplies that help with planting his crops, like: compost, seeds, fertilizers etc.  These supplies will also help to improve the land where he wants to plant, which is pictured in the photograph.  Then he would have better earnings and be able to continue helping with the household expenses without any restraints.

loans.use: to purchase compost, seeds, fertilizers etc. to improve his land.

loans.name: Olga Lidia

texts.es: Olga vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta y elaboración de muebles de madera  junto con su esposo desde hace vario años, tienen mucha clientela ya que su mercadería es de muy buena calidad y a precios muy cómodos, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Olga esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de madera, barniz, pegamento, clavos, etc. para poder seguir con su negocio y obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Olga lives in her own house with her husband and her three children.

She and her husband have earned a living for several years making and selling wood furniture.  They have a lot of customers because their merchandise is high quality and affordable.  With her profits she's able to pay for some of the household expenses.

Olga's requesting a loan to buy wood, varnish, glue, nails, etc., to be able to continue with her business and earn better profits to give her family better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy wood, varnish, glue, nails, etc.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en: Saima, age 26, is a married woman and a mother of four. She has been running a clothing sales business for many years. She purchases a variety of clothes from Faisalabad market and then sells them to the people of her community at reasonable rates. She has become famous for selling good quality clothes. Now she wants to expand her business and sell the clothes in the market as well, but due to low capital she is unable to allow her business to grow in this way. For this reason, Saima requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to buy a stock of different clothes in different colors, designs and fabrics according to summer season. This loan will allow her to generate more income that she will use for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different clothes in different colors, designs and fabrics according to summer season.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.es: Emerita de 46 años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos; ella se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene muchos años de trabajar en este rubro y se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, ella comercia en todas las zonas aledañas y ya tiene mucha clientela fija, estas personas siempre prefieren su producto pues es de calidad y a precios realmente accesibles además el servicio es inigualable, Emerita es una mujer dedicada a su labor, luchadora siempre dispuesta a trabajar duro para alcanzar el éxito, necesita invertir en insumos pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla, abono, insecticida, herramienta, etc.  y mejorar el terreno donde desea sembrar que es el que muestra la fotografía, Emerita  tiene buenas referencias de pago y está segura que podrá saldar su deuda a tiempo, y a la vez tiene la confianza que podrá darle a su familia la vida que se merecen.
texts.en:
Emerita, 46, lives with her life partner and her children.

She makes a living in agriculture, specifically growing corn and beans.  She has worked in this job for many years and has gained very valuable experience that allows her to get the best harvests.  She sells in all the neighboring areas and already has a lot of steady customers.  These people always prefer her product because of the quality and very affordable prices.  Also, her service is incomparable.

Emerita is a woman who's devoted to her job.  She strives and is always willing to work hard to achieve success.

She needs to invest in inputs but doesn't have enough capital.  She's asking Integral for a loan to buy seed, soil amendments, insecticide, tools, etc.  She's going to improve the plot of land where she wants to plant, which is shown in the photograph.

Emerita has a good credit record and she's sure she'll be able to repay the debt on time.  She also trusts she'll be able to give her family the life they deserve.

loans.use: to buy seed, soil amendments, insecticide, tools, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy clothes to sell at a profit.

loans.name: Gloria Amparo

texts.es: Gloria Amparo es una mujer de 44 años de edad, es casada y madre de un hijo. Fue criada en el campo, pero hace 14 años se le presentó la oportunidad de instalarse en la ciudad con su familia. Actualmente se desempeña como estilista y tiene su propia sala de belleza hace aproximadamente 10 años  ubicada en el primer piso de su casa. Este oficio lo aprendió gracias a la insistencia de su esposo para que se capacitara, inicialmente prestaba el servicio a domicilio, pero gracias a los créditos que ha tenido con la Corporación logró estabilizar su negocio y hasta ahora ha logrado aportar los ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Con el crédito que solicita desea comprar insumos al por mayor (tintes, cepillos, tratamientos capilares, entre otros) y también desea realizar mejoras locativas que mejoren la percepción de los clientes que la visitan. Su mayor deseo es continuar con su negocio, hacerlo crecer poco a poco pero que sea estable y perdurable en el tiempo y, de esta forma continuar luchando por una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en: Gloria Amparo is a 44-year old woman.  She is married and the mother of one son.  She was raised in the country, but fourteen years ago was presented with an opportunity to move into the city with her family.  She currently works as a stylist and has had her own beauty salon, located on the first floor of her house, for about ten years.  She learned this profession at her husband's insistence that she get her training.  At first, she offered her services in her client's homes, but thanks to the loans she has received from the Corporación she was able to establish her business and contribute financially to her household.  With the loan she is requesting, Gloria Amparo wants to purchase wholesale supplies (dyes, brushes, hair treatments and other items).  She also wants to make some improvements to her shop that will improve her customers' perception.  Gloria Amparo's greatest wish is to continue with her business, to grow it little by little while keeping it stable and long-lasting.  In this way, she will continue working for a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale supplies (dyes, brushes, hair treatments and other items) and to make some improvements to her shop

loans.name: Elkin Alonso

texts.es: Elkin Alonso es un hombre de 26 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su actual pareja y tiene un hijo de 1 año. Hace 4 años se dedica al comercio de licores, ya que montó su propia licorera con la cual ha logrado obtener ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia y suplir los gastos del hogar. Es un hombre trabajador y organizado, ya que dedica gran parte del día a laborar en su negocio, procurando que se mantenga organizado y bien surtido y de esta forma poder brindar una excelente atención a los clientes. Con el crédito que solicita en la Corporación desea comprar más surtido (licor, cerveza, mecato y confitería) con el único fin de ofrecer gran variedad de productos a sus clientes, mantener disponibilidad de productos y, de esta forma aumentar su nivel de ventas, para generar más ingresos mensuales que le permitan seguir velando por el bienestar y la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Elkin Alonso, 26, lives in a common-law marriage with his current partner and has a one-year-old child.

He has made a living selling liquor for four years.  He set up his own liquor store with which he has managed to earn income to support his family and pay for the household expenses.  He's a hardworking and organized man because he devotes a large part of his day to working in his business, making sure he keeps it organized and well stocked so he can provide excellent customer service.

With the loan he's requesting from the board he wants to buy more stock (liquor, beer, pastries, and sweets).

His only goal is to offer his customers a greater variety, keep products available, and consequently increase his level of sales to generate more monthly income.  This will allow him to continue watching over his family's welfare and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy liquor, beer, pastries, and sweets

loans.name: Kumba

texts.en:
Please meet 33-year-old Kumba from Buchanan. Buchanan is the capital city of Grand Bassa County and is located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia.

Kumba went to school, stopping in 6th grade. She is married and she has two children, both age 10, who are in school and live at home. She describes herself as a hardworking woman.

Kumba has a table business selling palm oil. She has been in business for ten years and works 10 hours each day at the business. She transports her goods by taxi. One of the greatest challenges that Kumba faces is low income, so, with this loan, she will buy palm oil for her business.

She started her business with money from her husband. Kumba is proud of her business because of the profits she makes. Her future plan is to build a house. She thanks you in advanced for your support!

loans.use: to buy palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Please meet 39-year-old Elizabeth from Buchanan. Buchanan is the capital city of Grand Bassa County and is located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Elizabeth completed 5th grade before starting her business. She is married. She has two children, age 24 and 12. Only one is in school and lives at home. She describes herself as a hardworking woman.  

Elizabeth has table business which sells toothpaste, soap, batteries, etc. She has been in business for three years and works 10 hours each day at her business. With this loan, she will buy toothpaste, soap, batteries, etc.  

One of the greatest challenges that she faces is low income. She transports her goods by taxi. She started her business with money from her husband.  She is proud of her business because of the profit she makes. Her future plan is to build a house. She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to buy toothpaste, soap, batteries, etc.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en: Sajida is a 42-year-old married woman and mother of four children. She is a very talented lady and excels in her work of stitching. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Her customers’ demand is increasing day by day, but due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested for a loan of 35,000 PKR to purchase more reels of threads with packs of buttons, zippers and laces in various colors. She is in her third loan cycle with Kashf Foundation. She hopes to grow her business as well as dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads with packs of buttons, zippers and laces in various colors.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia is a 33-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She has been actively involved in the business of cloth sales for six years. She purchases a variety of cloths from the market and then resells it to the people of her community. She has become famous for selling good quality cloths in her community. Shazia requested for a loan of 30,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of cloths in different colors and designs by taking in account the choices and tastes of her customers. She is in her sixth loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of cloths in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Tasmia

texts.en: Tasmia is 46 years old and a vigorous, married woman. She has been running a business of cloth sales for about eight years. She purchases a variety of cloths from the main city and then sells them to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloths in her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. She is requesting a 30,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan, and she plans to spend the part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Nitu

texts.en:
This is 26-year-old Nitu. She is married and has two children, ages 6 and 4. In 2007, she established her meat shop business. Working seven days a week and five hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan to buy buffalo for her business. 

In the future, Nitu plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In Nepal, the meat is always fresh. In small stalls along busy roads, open-air butcher shops sell chicken, goat and water buffalo by the kilo. The stalls are piled high with product and sales are brisk. With the help of a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase additional stock at better prices. This increase in purchasing volume creates greater profit margins for the borrower.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi is 36 years old. She is married and has three children, ages 13, 7 and 3. In 2002, she established her meat shop business. Working seven days a week and five hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan to buy chickens and buffalo for her business. 

In the future, Laxmi plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In Nepal, the meat is always fresh. In small stalls along busy roads, open-air butcher shops sell chicken, goat and water buffalo by the kilo. The stalls are piled high with product, and sales are brisk. With the help of a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase additional stock at better prices. This increase in purchasing volume creates greater profit margins for the borrower.

loans.use: to buys chickens and buffalo for her business.

loans.name: Deemar

texts.en:
Deemar is 32 years old and lives and works in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County, located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia.

She lives along with her husband and three children, who are between the ages of 15 and 7; all three of them are in school. She has been selling used clothes for the past two years in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. She likes her business because it helps to support her home. She hopes to one day own a house.  

She wants to thank the Kiva lenders in advance for their help.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en: Farzana is 40 years old and an energetic, married woman. Two years ago she started her own business of flower making. She knows the method of making beautiful flowers from fabric and paper. The immense experience in the art of flower making has lent her great versatility in making flowers to meet her clients' needs. She is a mother of eight children and is motivated to provide them the basic necessities of life including food, clothes and education. She wants to expand her business and applied for a loan of 25,000 PKR to buy raw materials including wires, cutters, floral tape, scissors, beads, paints and tissue papers. This will help her to increase her sales. It’s her third year with Kashf Foundation, and she has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of revenue to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy raw materials including wires, cutters, floral tape, scissors, beads, paints and tissue papers.

loans.name: Babita

texts.en:
Babita is 36 years old. She is married and has two children, ages 17 and 19. In 2004, she established her poultry business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW: her most recent loan was used to buy small chicks for her business.

In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business. Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, food, and necessary medicine to keep the chickens healthy. Once matured, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open air markets throughout the valley.

In the future, Babita plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy small chicks

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Please meet 32-year-old Viola from Buchanan. Buchanan is the capital city of Grand Bassa County and is located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Viola did not go to school and is married. She describes herself as a hardworking woman. She has three children between the ages of 10 years and 7 months. Only two are in school and live at home. 

Viola has table business which sells used clothes, toothpaste, soap, candles, etc. She has been in business for three years and works 10 hours each day at the business. With this loan, she will buy used clothes, toothpaste, soap, candles, etc. One of the greatest challenges that she faces is low income.  She transports her goods by taxi. She started her business with money from her husband. She is proud of her business because of the profit she makes.

Her future plan is to build a house. She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to will buy used clothes, toothpaste, soap, candles, etc.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a 30-year-old, hard-working man. He is single and supports his four siblings. He is a farmer on his own piece of land; he has been doing this for the last ten years.

Jackson learned about KADET from women who are already registered members of KADET LTD. This will be his eighth loan of 90,000 KES after having paid back the previous loans successfully. He plans to use the loan amount to buy chemicals and fertilizer for his wheat farm. Due to climatic conditions and fertile soil, wheat has proved to do very well and also the market is readily available in the area for both retail and wholesale buyers.

Jackson hopes to use the profits from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming. His dream is to venture into large-scale farming and have his own farm machinery. Jackson is very determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is 40 years old and married with three children. She is a responsible and hardworking woman. Estelita's spouse is a farmer and hog raiser within their local community. She is grateful because during the previous crop season, she was able to produce a better rice crop. 

With regards to her aim to have a continuously smooth flow of her rice crop production, she is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP (Philippines pesos), allowing her to buy necessary farm inputs such as fertilizer and insecticides. She knows that through proper application of the necessary farm inputs to her rice farmland, she can further obtain greater yields and income and be able to educate her two children who currently go to school.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and insecticides for development of her rice farming business.

loans.name: Maria Montesori

texts.es:
En la cálida ciudad de Pucallpa vive Maria, una mujer de 38 años madre de 1 pequeño de 9 años a quien ama mucho y sobre todo porque Maria lucha cada día para poder sacarlo adelante.  Con mucho esfuerzo logro estudiar la carrera de educación, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar la carrera de administración.

Cada día desde muy temprano Maria sale a trabajar como empleada en una pequeña empresa distribuidora de su ciudad, ella labora alrededor de 9 horas al día y  también tiene un pequeño negocio de maderería y con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar los gastos de su hogar; ella cree que está saliendo adelante porque es muy responsable y sobre todo tiene la mejor motivación del mundo, la cual es su hijo.

Maria está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar madera para su negocio  ya que tiene varios pedidos de clientes , lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:”  Darle una profesión a su hijo”.
texts.en:
María, 38, lives in the warm city of Pucallpa.  She's the mother of nine-year-old child whom she loves very much and for whom she strives every day so he can get ahead.  With a lot of effort she managed to study education, but she very much would like to have studied business administration.

Every day María goes out very early to work as an employee in a small distributor business in her city.  She works around nine hours a day and also has a small lumber business.  With the fruit of her work she's able to pay for her household expenses.  She believes she's getting ahead because she's very responsible and she has the greatest motivation in the world--her son.

María's very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to their help she'll be able to buy wood for her business, because she has several customer orders.

This will allow her to improve her income and continue striving to make her biggest dream a reality: "To give her son a profession."

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
At the age of 26, Abida is an energetic woman. She has been running a flower-making business for three years. It’s been a passion of hers: she knows the method of making beautiful flowers from fabric, paper and other materials. She also arranges handmade wedding garlands for brides and grooms, and flowers out every material she finds suitable. The immense experience in the art of flower making has lent her great versatility in making flowers to meet her clients' needs.

She is in her third loan cycle with Kashf Foundation; currently she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR. This will help her to purchase raw materials, including different types of fabrics, such as silk, tissue and cotton, along with some packs of glue and wire. With the purchase of these materials, she will be able to get an increase in her earnings through her large sales. Abida is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move in a positive direction as a result of loan investment.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials, including different types of fabrics, such as silk, tissue and cotton, along with some packs of glue and wire.

loans.name: Romana

texts.en:
Romana is 58 years old, married and has four children.

Romana is in the agricultural business of hog raising in the Philippines. Romana requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Romana has been in hog raising for 13 years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Romana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anching

texts.en:
Anching is a 37-year-old businesswoman. She dreams of a better future for her family, and this inspires her to manage a general store business. Her income from selling different grocery items helps a lot in providing for the growing needs of her family. 

Anching started managing her store several years ago. She wants to earn income for their future emergencies. To have more business growth, she is now requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to purchase more grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, bread and beverages to sell. She will use the loan as additional capital to improve and expand her retailing business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items.

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en: Sobia is a 22-year-old married woman and mother of one. She is shown in the photo with her husband who is a driver by profession, providing transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Sobia has applied for a loan of 20,000 PKR for her husband. He will use the loan amount to purchase new tires and to replace an auto rickshaw body part. Sobia is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to purchase new tires and to replace an auto rickshaw body part.

loans.name: Salaama

texts.en: Salaama is 28 years old. She lives in Masindi, Uganda. She is married and charged with a responsibility of taking care of one child. She operates a retail shop, whereby she sells general merchandise. With the proceeds, she has been able to reinvest in the business and support her family in providing their basic needs. Her dream is to educate her child up to the university while her business plan is to own a wholesale shop. Salaama intends to use the loan to buy general merchandise such as salt and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as salt and soap to sell.

loans.name: Mayra

texts.es:
Mayra es una joven estudiante de 23 años, además de estar estudiando se encuentra trabajando como Recepcionista en un consultorio Odontológico hace más de un año.
Tiene  un hermano menor que se encuentra aun en la primaria, otro también estudiante universitario que se encuentra trabajando en un estudio contable. Su padre aun trabaja y su madre es ama de casa
Mayra se graduara en un periodo de 3 años en la carrera de kinesiología, una carrera que le encanta, ya que puede ayudar a las personas. Espera graduarse para acceder a un trabajo con mejor salario y así mejorar su calidad de vida. Ella en el futuro anhela poder ser una excelente profesional y establecerse con su propio consultorio.
Solicita de este crédito para poder pagar sus cuotas de la universidad y seguir cubriendo así sus gastos de estudio.
texts.en:
Mayra, 23, is a young student.  In addition to attending school she also has been working for more than a year as a receptionist in a dental office.  She has a younger brother who's still in elementary school; another one is also a college student who works in an accounting office.  Her father still works and her mother's a housewife.

Mayra will graduate from the kinesiology program in three years.  She loves the career because she can help people.  She hopes to graduate and get a job with a better salary so she can improve her quality of life.  In the future she hopes to be an excellent professional and set up her own office.

She's requesting this loan to be able to pay her university fees and continue covering her school expenses.

loans.use: to pay her university fees and expenses

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 51 years old and married with eight children. With four children currently in school, Vilma works very hard to provide for them.

Vilma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 18,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like soap, sugar, shampoo, soft drinks and other groceries in her general store.

Vilma has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as soap, sugar, shampoo, soft drinks and other groceries. 

In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like soap, sugar, shampoo, soft drinks and other groceries in her general store.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en: Jeniffer is a 46-year-old married woman with four children living in Masindi, Uganda. She operates a retail shop while also earning additional income from her rental houses. With what little earnings she has, she educated her children and started on building her residential house. She dreams of completing her house, although she lacks enough capital. Jeniffer is requesting a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 35-year-old married woman running a small general store in her community with the support of her son. She is a mother of four children; one of her sons is shown in the photo. After being let out from school her son also runs the shop. They offer a variety of grocery items at reasonable prices and have retained many customers who regularly shop at their store.

Naseem makes enough to provide for her family. However, to fully stock her store, she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR, which she will use to buy packs of salt, rice, sugar, flour, biscuits and beverages from the market at lower rates. This will enable her to consistently meet increasing demand. Naseem wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, rice, sugar, flour, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en: At the age of 32, Sakina is an energetic married woman. She has been running a flower manufacturing business for many years; it’s been a passion of hers. She offers various colorful flowers for decorating homes and events like birthdays, parties, etc. She sells them to the people of her community and also supplies the local market. Sakina's immense experience in the art of flower-making has lent her great versatility in making flowers to meet her clients' needs. She is in her fifth loan cycle with Kashf Foundation and, for the improvement of her business, she requires a loan of 20,000 PKR to buy raw materials including wires, cutters, floral tape, scissors, beads, paints and tissue paper. Sakina is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move in a positive direction as a result of loan investment.

loans.use: to buy raw materials including wires, cutters, floral tape, scissors, beads, paints and tissue paper.

loans.name: Basudev Group

texts.en:
Dakuluguda is a remote tribal village of Rayagada district in Odisha, India. Most of the inhabitants of this village are tribal. In the year 2010, six active women entrepreneurs in this village formed a group named Basudev to access a loan from Mahashakti Foundation to expand their existing businesses. Mamata is one of them. The lady standing third from right, touching the flour-milling machine, is Mamata. She is an energetic lady of 30 years who lives with her husband, one son who is nine years old and one daughter who is 13 years old. Both her children are continuing their primary education in the village school. 

Mamata has been running a wheat flour milling business in her village with a single machine for the last five years. Her husband is helping her in this business. She earns a daily net income of 400 INR from the existing businesses. Out of this income, she has been able to manage her household expenses in a decent manner. So Mamata is planning to increase her income by expanding the business. Looking into the demand of the locality, with the present loan, Mamata wants to put another two units of machine in her center. One is for processing flattened rice and another is for wheat flour. She is convinced that this will generate a handsome income for her. Mamata hopes to save enough money to provide a better education for her children and construct another hall for the new machines.

The other five members of the group are Sabutri and Sushila who have a general store business, Laxmi who has a Tiffin center with a fast food center, Gayatree who has a tailoring center and Pausa who has a barber shop businesses, respectively.

loans.use: To purchase machinery for flattened rice and wheat flour milling.

loans.name: Robila

texts.en: Robila is a 26-year-old married woman. She is efficiently running an ice cream cart with the support of her husband. Both are working together happily to support their family. Robila is expert in making ice cream at home while her husband assists her by selling it door-to-door in their community. Robila is a mother of one child; she needs to cover the educational expenses along with other expenses. For the expansion of her business she is planning to buy another cart to start the sales from their home as well. Robila contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs 20,000. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy another ice cream cart.

loans.name: Maa Annapurna Group

texts.en: “MAA ANNAPURNA”, a Joint Liability Group, was formed in the year 2009 by four active women from Khariar town of Nuapada district in Odisha, India. Sandhyarani is one of the members of this group, standing second from the left with her hand raised. She is 31 years of age and lives in a rented house with her husband and two sons who are nine and seven years old. Ten years ago, Sandhyarani’s husband migrated to this place from the coastal belt and worked in a barber shop as a daily wage earner for three years. In the year 2007, Sandhyarani started a one-seat barber shop of her own in a low profile with the help of her husband. In the subsequent years, with three consecutive loans from Mahashakti Foundation, she developed her shop into three seats by taking a rented cabin in the heart of the town. She has engaged two male workers for giving service to the customers. She earns a monthly income of 8,000 INR from her barber shop, which is not at all sufficient to manage the household expenses, the education expenses of her children and the regular expenses for the business. As she is an outsider to this place, she doesn’t have her own house to live. Therefore, Sandhyarani want to increase her income by adding some extra facility to the existing business for generating the minimum necessities of her family. This is the fourth loan of Sandhyarani and she wants to purchase a facial machine, a massage machine and two big mirrors. She also wants to repair the existing moving chairs. From this investment, she expects a good return for the total development of her family. With the extra income, Sandhyarani hopes to purchase a plot of land and construct a house for her family. She also dreams of giving a better education to her children. The other three members of this group are Janaki, Pusbabai and Satyabhama who are running a betel nut shop with a tailoring center, vending vegetables and running a tea stall with biscuits and snacks, respectively.

loans.use: To purchase a facial machine, massage machine and two big mirrors

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: Fred is a 39-year-old married man with four children living in Masindi, Uganda. He has been running a retail shop business since 2011 and also earns a salary as a civil servant to boost his income. He hopes to educate his children to the university level. He wants to grow his business to a wholesale shop despite challenges of theft and customers who fail to pay on time. Fred is requesting a loan to buy general merchandise like sugar, salt and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise like sugar, salt and soap to sell.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline and her husband are managing their rice farming business. They share ideas in growing their rice crops to have a productive outcome. They keep on working hard to support the education of their children.   

They are times when Evangeline cannot provide for all their farming needs due to lack of funds which sometimes has some effect on their crops. In line with this, she is now asking for financial assistance of lenders for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy fertilizer, herbicides and to pay the labor costs on their farm.  Evangeline is hoping that by providing for the needs of the farm, she can have a better yield and get a higher income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en: Najma is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of three. She has expertise in embroidery and has been using her skill to provide for her family for many years. She started this line of work at a very young age. Her embroidery patterns are very popular in her community. Her customers’ demand is increasing day by day but due to lack of capital she is unable to meet those demands. For this reason, she requested a loan of Rs. 35,000 to buy reels of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. She is hopeful of increasing her income by targeting more customers. She dreams for her children's bright future and desires to provide them a better living standard.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins, and stones for embellishment.

loans.name: Aaron

texts.en:
Aaron, originally from New Orleans, has been in the Cajun pie business for over 21 years baking personal-size, creole-filled pies.  Before Hurricane Katrina, the hurricane that killed at least 1,330 people, injured thousands, and left cities of people homeless including Aaron and his family, his New Orleans business served more than 30 restaurants and many prominent individuals, including political leaders and celebrities.  After Katrina, they were forced to move to Atlanta to start their new life. 

It was not long until they moved back to New Orleans to sell their pies, but it wasn’t the same.  Many customers and businesses that were once dedicated clients of Aaron, were now gone.

With the absence of loyal customers and an increase in the crime in the New Orleans area, Aaron and his family decided to move once again, but this time, they went west to Austin, Texas.

Aaron re-launched his catering business in late 2011 and is now opening a sit down restaurant.  The New Orleans Cajun Pie Man will serve flaky crawfish etouffee, jambalaya, New Orleans pasta, and a variety of lemon, pecan, apple, cherry and peach pies.  To take his catering business to the next level and open his restaurant, Aaron needed additional capital.  A friend informed him about Accion Texas Inc. and what the nonprofit microlender could do for him. Aaron applied and was approved.  

With the Accion loan, Aaron was able to purchase additional equipment for his kitchen in the new restaurant, lease a new property, and sustained three jobs.  

Aaron plans to hire additional help in the near future to continue business expansion. But for now, Aaron says, “The Accion loan will help me open my restaurant with the proper tools, and relieve some stress.”

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment for his kitchen in the new restaurant, lease a new property, and retain three jobs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo  es de la ciudad de san Lorenzo, vive con sus padres es hijo único, su madre es docente y su padre es empleado de una empresa. Su meta futura es trabajar como administrador en una empresa y tener ingresos para poder mantenerse y ayudar a su familia. Es por eso que está estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas, para poder estar a un paso de su sueño.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en las cuotas de su universidad, para que así pueda aligerar a su familia. Agradece por esta ayuda que está recibiendo
texts.en:
Pablo is from the city of San Lorenzo.  He lives with his parents and is an only child.  His mother's a teacher and his father's employed by a company.

His future goal is to work as the administrator of a company and have income to support himself and help his family.  This is why he's studying business administration, to be able to be a step away from his dream.

He's requesting this loan to be able to pay his university fees so he can relieve the pressure on his family.

He's grateful for the help he's receiving.

loans.use: to pay his university fees

loans.name: Edina

texts.en: Edina is a 37-year-old married woman with eight children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in a retail business for five years and with the proceeds, she has been able to pay school fees for her children. She hopes to educate her children to higher levels of learning and to grow her business into a wholesale shop. However, bad debts and lack of enough capital are big challenges. Edina will use the loan to buy rice, maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy rice, maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Originally from Nigeria, Henry moved to Houston and began his mail assistance business, Elnegy, LLC.   He operates the business with the help of one full-time and one part-time employee.  It has been open for four years and is an authorized shipper for the United States Postal Service, DHL, and FedEx and offers dozens of different services. 

With more than 50 box sizes on hand, Elnegy takes care of every shape and size package for foreign and domestic shipping.  Henry offers overnight, two- or three-day delivery, ground shipping, and first class, express, international, certified, bulk and priority mail services.  Elengy also provides stamps.

Henry, however, doesn’t restrict his services to simply shipping.  He offers printing, too.  Whether a customer needs black and white or color, letter, legal or ledger size, binding, laminating or collating, digital or self-service - or even blueprints - Henry can help his customers in every way.

A detailed listing of all of his services is on his website: www.elnegybusiness.com/.  And though he uses the site as a primary form of advertising, Henry knew he needed to diversify his marketing.  After he learned of Accion Texas Inc. from one of his customers, Henry decided to venture to the microlender for a loan. 

The 42-year-old says he plans to expand his business by adding two employees in the future, but is taking needed steps to grow Elnegy.  He is using his Accion loan to fund further marketing and advertising.  He also says with Accion’s loan, he will be able to increase revenues and sustain jobs.

loans.use: to pay for marketing and advertising

loans.name: Sonia Yaneth

texts.es: Sonia Yaneth es una mujer de 29 años de edad, es casada y tiene un bebé de 9 meses. Siempre ha vivido en el campo y por herencia familiar se dedica a la cría de pollos y gallinas y en compañía de su esposo tienen vacas productoras de leche, ellos venden sus animales y con ello obtienen los ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora y lucha día a día para salir adelante. Con el crédito que solicita en la Corporación desea comprar más vacas lecheras para aumentar la producción del líquido y poder incrementar sus ventas, lo que le generaría mayores ingresos económicos. Su principal sueño es aumentar su ganado y la cría de pollos para aumentar sus ingresos y tener mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Sonia Yaneth is a 29 year old woman. She is married and has a 9 month-old baby. She has always lived in the countryside and by family tradition she raises chickens with her husband and they also have dairy cows. They sell their animals to earn income to sustain their household. She is an entrepreneurial and hardworking woman. She works hard every day to get ahead. With the loan she is requesting from the Corporation, she wants to buy more dairy cows to increase milk production and increase her sales. This would generate a greater income. Her dream is to grow her herd and the number of chickens in order to increase her income and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows.

loans.name: Eng

texts.en:
Eng is 54 years old. He is a widower and resides with four children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. Three of his children are employed as construction workers and a garment worker. They earn about $12 per day. 

Eng has been running a motor taxi service for more than ten years, earning approximately $6 daily.  Because the present motorbike is old, he is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase a motorbike. This purchase will help him attract more customers and earn more income for the family. In the future, he would like to build a new house if possible.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to run the taxi service

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Nforneh Pauline

texts.en:
The borrower is married with two children. They live in a two-bedroom apartment house in the Bamenda Mezam Division of the northwest region of Cameroon. She has faced so many challenges in life, including sickness in her family, inadequate finances to manage her business, the sudden death of her child, and constant theft of her business items.

With this new loan, she plans to expand her foodstuff business by buying food items like palm oil, cocoyam (taro), beans, rice, groundnut, salt, groundnut oil, plantains and drinks. She holds a positive view of her business succeeding because she has been in the business for a long time, she has experience in the business, she has regular customers who buy from her, and her business is situated at a strategic point for marketing.  With the profit from this loan, she will engage in poultry farming, provide for her granddaughter's education, and take care of other necessities in the family. She prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals.

loans.use: To buy drinks and food items like palm oil, cocoyam, beans, rice, groundnut and salt

loans.name: Abundancia Group

texts.es: Abundancia es un grupo responsable y cumplido que tiene 3 ciclos con su crédito. Teresa es una de sus integrantes, una mujer joven de 25 años, casada y con 2 hijas de 5 y 1 años. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, tiene una tienda y el crédito le  ayudará a hacer que crezca invirtiendo en mercancía. Teresa es una mujer que desea salir adelante junto con su familia, ya que quiere darle un buen estudio a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Abundancia is a responsible and accomplished group that has had 3 loans. Teresa is one of its members. She is a young, 25-year-old woman and is married with two daughters, ages 5 and 1. She sells groceries for a living. She has a store and the loan will help her grow her business by investing in merchandise. 

Teresa is a woman who wants to get ahead with her family because she wants to give her daughters a good education.

loans.use: to stock goods and groceries

loans.name: Abril Group

texts.es: Abril es un grupo solidario que tiene 3 ciclos con su crédito, sus integrantes son mujeres trabajadoras y cumplidas con sus pagos. Blanca es una de ellas, tiene 35 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos; se dedica a la venta de jugos naturales y snak en casa, comenzó hace 3 años aproximadamente y el crédito la ayudará para meter la venta de elotes y obtener mas ganancia. Actualmente esta acondicionando el porche de su casa para tener mas espacio en su negocio, su esposo también la apoya con la venta y durante el día se turnan para atender a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Abril is a solidarity group which has received three loans to date. The members are hard-working women and reliable with their payments.

Blanca is one of the members; she is 35 years old, married, and has four children. She began selling fresh juice and snacks from her home three years ago, and this loan will help her to also start selling corn on the cob and increase profits. Blanca is currently remodeling the porch of her house to have more space for her business. Her husband helps her with the sales and during the day, they take turns looking after customers.

loans.use: to purchase corn on the cob to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to maintain her shop.

loans.name: Faleupolu

texts.en: Faleupolu is 23 years old and married with 2 children. She has a small garden where she grows taro plants that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years. Faleupolu needs a loan to buy fertilizer, taro plants, a wheelbarrow, bush knives, gloves and a rake. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Faleupolu will use the profits from her sales to expand her business and to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, taro plants, a wheelbarrow, bush knives, gloves and a rake.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
The borrower is a single mother of two children, one of whom is below the age of fifteen. She lives in a two-room apartment in Bamenda in the Northwest Region of Cameroon. She has faced some difficulties in life, including sickness and the loss of family members such as her father and mother. Poverty in the general family has also been a problem, and starting up a business was not possible.

She plans to buy two-week-old fowls, as well as feed and the necessary vaccine for the fowls. Part of the loan will be invested in buying provision items such as tinned tomatoes, Maggi, oil, and rice. She believes that her business will succeed because she has been selling and keeping fowls for a long time. The high demand for fowls and manure in the community is another reason for the success of her business. The community will benefit from the supply of fowls, and the manure will also be sold to the public. They will not have to go a long distance to buy provision items. 

The profits will help her improve the housing conditions of the family and provide better education and health for her and her only child. She will also expand her business. She prefers GHAPE because of the convenient repayment period, low interest, and the social education they provide.

loans.use: to buy fowls, feed, vaccine, and provision items.

loans.name: Byambadonid

texts.en: Byambadonid, 22 years old, lives with his mother, two brothers, and uncle in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. Byambadonid began working as an electrician right after graduating from college. His brother works as a waiter at a restaurant and his mother currently stays at home looking after his youngest brother. Before his full-time job, Byambadonid had been working with his mother by renting a small workshop near their home and providing computer repair services to local people. Now, he is requesting a loan of 4000000 MNT to open a grocery store as an additional income source. The loan will be used to pay for rent, working capital, and building materials. In addition to purchasing food products in large quantities, he will rent a building appropriate for running a grocery store and will renovate it with bricks and cement.  As a result, he will be able to generate more income for his family and improve their standard of living. The borrower is a very hard-working individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to run a grocery store

loans.name: Nyambayar

texts.en:
Mr. Nyambayar is 25 years old and lives with his wife in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. The couple rents an apartment where he, together with his wife, runs a computer spare parts sales business. They have run their business since 2011 and a lot of people have come to recognize their high quality service. Before this business, he used to work as a loan officer at a bank. 

Nyambayar has recently purchased land in another city and wants to build a fence surrounding his land. He is requesting a loan of 2000000 MNT to purchase planks, nails, and an available gate. In the future, he is willing to build his own house on his land. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who is improving his life with each passing day.

loans.use: to build a fence surrounding his land.

loans.name: Santos Victoriano

texts.es: Don Santos, es una persona responsable, habita en el Ayote, es soltero no tiene hijos vive con su mama. Se dedica a la venta de comida y refrescos de manera ambulante los que hace su mama y él los vende, es su único medio de ingresos para cubrir los gastos del hogar. Solicita el crédito para comprar granos básicos, verduras, azúcar, frutas entre otros ingredientes y darle mejor presentación a su carretón que es la unidad de trabajo, el tiene establecida su clientela y su mayor propósito es hacer crecer su pequeño negocio para mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir apoyando a su madre.
texts.en:
Don Santos is a responsible person living in El Ayote. He is single, with no children, and lives with his mother. He sells the food and drinks that he and his mother make as a street vendor. It is their only means of income to cover their household expenses.

He is requesting this loan to buy basic grains, vegetables, sugar, fruit and other ingredients, and to improve the look of his cart which is work vehicle. He has an established customer base, and his main goal is to grow his small business to improve his quality of life and continue to support his mother.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, sugar, fruit and other items

loans.name: Leidis Mariela

texts.es: La joven Leidis,es soltera ahora trabaja como asistente de carta de venta y fierro en la municipalidad, labor con la que intenta salir adelante, aspira culminar sus estudios universitarios y mejorar sus condiciones de vida junto a su familia. Solicita su 3er crédito para ser invertido en mejoras de su vivienda y así poder comprar primeramente los materiales de construcción y después empezar la obra,                                                        para poder tener una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Leidis is a young single woman. She now works for the municipality as an assistant that handles paperwork relating to livestock sales and registry of brands, a job that she hopes will help her get ahead. She aspires to complete her university studies and to improve her living conditions with her family. 

She is applying for her third loan, which will be used for improvements to her home. Initially, she will buy building materials and then start construction, so she can have decent housing.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron, sand, and cinder blocks.

loans.name: Qorichuspa Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “QORICHUSPA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Ollantaytambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

La socia es la Sra. Marina ella es soltera y tiene 37 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de verduras y frutas, la socia vende manzanas,naranjas,uvas,platanos y mandarinas, la socia también vende zanahorias, tomates y pepinos, la socia tiene un puesto de mercado donde vende las frutas y verduras, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las frutas y verduras. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar naranjas,platanos,uvas,cebollas,zanahorias y pepinos.
El socio que esta tapado con un circulo su cara ya no pertenece al banco comunal Qorichuspa.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo despues la foto porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de cerámicas, negocio de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.


 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The borrowers belong to the Qorichuspa communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Ollantaytambo, which belongs to the province of Urubamba and department of Cusco.
